en: Preliminary Estimates of the Prevalence of Selected Underlying Health Conditions Among Patients with Coronavirus Disease 2019 — United States, February 12–March 28, 2020
zh: 2019 冠状病毒疾病患者部分基础疾病患病率的初步估计 — 美国，2020 年 2 月 12 日至 3 月 28 日
pert_zh: 2019 冠状病毒疾病患者部分疾病患病率的初步估计 — 美国，2020 年 2 月 12 日至 3 月 28 日
bt_pert_zh: Preliminary estimates of the prevalence of selected illnesses among patients with coronavirus disease 2019 — United States, February 12 to March 28, 2020

en: On March 11, 2020, the World Health Organization declared Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) a pandemic.
zh: 2020 年 3 月 11 日，世界卫生组织宣布 2019 冠状病毒疾病 (COVID-19) 为大流行病。
pert_zh: 2020 年 3 月 11 日，宣布 2019 冠状病毒疾病 (COVID-19) 为大流行病。
bt_pert_zh: On March 11, 2020, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) was declared a pandemic.

en: As of March 28, 2020, a total of 571,678 confirmed COVID-19 cases and 26,494 deaths have been reported worldwide.
zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月 28 日，全球总共报告 571,678 名 COVID-19 确诊病例和 26,494 例死亡。
pert_zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月 28 日，全球总共报告 571,678 名 COVID-19 确诊病例。
bt_pert_zh: As of March 28, 2020, a total of 571,678 confirmed cases of COVID-19 have been reported worldwide.

en: Reports from China and Italy suggest that risk factors for severe disease include older age and the presence of at least one of several underlying health conditions.
zh: 来自中国和意大利的报告表明，重症的危险因素包括高龄以及合并几种基础疾病的至少一种。
pert_zh: 来自中国和意大利的报告表明，重症的危险因素包括高龄以及几种基础疾病的至少一种。
bt_pert_zh: Reports from China and Italy suggest that risk factors for severe illness include advanced age and at least one of several underlying medical conditions.

en: U.S. older adults, including those aged ≥65 years and particularly those aged ≥85 years, also appear to be at higher risk for severe COVID-19–associated outcomes; however, data describing underlying health conditions among U.S. COVID-19 patients have not yet been reported.
zh: 美国的老年人，包括年龄 ≥65 岁的老年人，尤其是年龄 ≥85 岁的老年人，似乎也有发生重症 COVID-19 相关结局的较高风险；但是，尚未报告过美国 COVID-19 患者基础疾病情况的数据。
pert_zh: 美国的老年人，包括年龄 ≥65 岁的老年人，尤其是年龄 ≥85 岁的老年人，似乎也有发生重症 COVID-19 相关结局的较高风险；但是，报告过美国 COVID-19 患者基础疾病情况的数据。
bt_pert_zh: Older adults in the United States, including those aged ≥65 years and especially those aged ≥85 years, also appear to be at higher risk for severe COVID-19-related outcomes; however, data on underlying medical conditions in patients with COVID-19 in the United States have been reported.

en: As of March 28, 2020, U.S. states and territories have reported 122,653 U.S. COVID-19 cases to CDC, including 7,162 (5.8%) for whom data on underlying health conditions and other known risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections were reported.
zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月 28 日，美国各州和领地已向 CDC 报告 122,653 名美国 COVID-19 病例，其中 7,162 名 (5.8%) 报告了有关基础疾病以及呼吸道感染严重后果的其他已知危险因素的数据。
pert_zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月 28 日，美国各州和领地已向 CDC 报告 122,653 名美国 COVID-19 病例，其中 7,162 名 (5.8%) 报告了有关基础疾病以及呼吸道感染严重后果的其他已知危险因素数据。
bt_pert_zh: As of March 28, 2020, states and territories had reported 122,653 U.S. COVID-19 cases to CDC, of ​​which 7,162 (5.8%) reported data on underlying medical conditions and other known risk factors for severe outcomes of respiratory infections.

en: Among these 7,162 cases, 2,692 (37.6%) patients had one or more underlying health condition or risk factor, and 4,470 (62.4%) had none of these conditions reported.
zh: 在这 7,162 起病例中，有 2,692 名 (37.6%) 患者存在一种或多种基础疾病或危险因素，而 4,470 名 (62.4%) 患者没有报告任何基础疾病和危险因素。
pert_zh: 在这 7,162 起病例中，有 2,692 名 (37.6%) 患者存在一种或多种基础疾病或危险因素，而 4,470 名 (62.4%) 患者没有任何基础疾病和危险因素。
bt_pert_zh: Of the 7,162 cases, 2,692 (37.6%) patients had one or more underlying diseases or risk factors, while 4,470 (62.4%) patients had none.

en: The percentage of COVID-19 patients with at least one underlying health condition or risk factor was higher among those requiring intensive care unit (ICU) admission (358 of 457, 78%) and those requiring hospitalization without ICU admission (732 of 1,037, 71%) than that among those who were not hospitalized (1,388 of 5,143, 27%).
zh: 在需要收入重症监护病房 (ICU) 的患者 (358/457, 78%) 以及需要住院治疗但不需要收入 ICU 的患者 (732/1,037, 71%) 中，存在至少一种基础疾病或危险因素的 COVID-19 患者百分比明显高于不需要住院治疗的患者 (1,388/5,143, 27%)。
pert_zh: 在需要收入重症监护病房的患者 (358/457, 78%) 以及需要住院治疗但不需要收入 ICU 的患者 (732/1,037, 71%) 中，存在至少一种基础疾病或危险因素的 COVID-19 患者百分比明显高于不需要住院治疗的患者 (1,388/5,143, 27%)。
bt_pert_zh: The percentage of COVID-19 patients with at least one underlying disease or risk factor was significantly higher among patients who required intensive care unit admission (358/457, 78%) and those who required hospitalization but not ICU admission (732/1,037, 71%) than among those who did not require hospitalization (1,388/5,143, 27%).

en: The most commonly reported conditions were diabetes mellitus, chronic lung disease, and cardiovascular disease.
zh: 最常报告的基础疾病是糖尿病、慢性肺病和心血管病。
pert_zh: 最常报告的基础疾病是糖尿病和心血管病。
bt_pert_zh: The most commonly reported underlying diseases were diabetes and cardiovascular disease.

en: These preliminary findings suggest that in the United States, persons with underlying health conditions or other recognized risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections appear to be at a higher risk for severe disease from COVID-19 than are persons without these conditions.
zh: 这些初步结果表明，在美国，存在基础疾病以及呼吸道感染严重后果的其他已知危险因素的个体发生重症 COVID-19 的风险似乎高于不存在这些情况的个体。
pert_zh: 这些初步结果表明，在美国，存在基础疾病以及呼吸道感染严重后果的个体发生重症 COVID-19 的风险似乎高于不存在这些情况的个体。
bt_pert_zh: These preliminary results suggest that in the United States, individuals with underlying medical conditions and severe outcomes from respiratory infections appear to be at higher risk for developing severe COVID-19 than those without these conditions.

en: Data from laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 cases reported to CDC from 50 states, four U.S. territories and affiliated islands, the District of Columbia, and New York City with February 12–March 28, 2020 onset dates were analyzed.
zh: 对 50 个州、四处美国领地和附属岛屿、哥伦比亚特区以及纽约市向 CDC 报告的在 2020 年 2 月 12 日至 3 月 28 日发病并经实验室确诊的 COVID-19 病例的数据进行了分析。
pert_zh: 对 50 个州、四处美国领地和附属岛屿、哥伦比亚特区以及纽约市向 CDC 报告的在 2020 年 2 月 12 日至 3 月 28 日发病并经实验室确诊的 COVID-19 病例的数据分析。
bt_pert_zh: Analysis of data from the 50 states, four U.S. territories and islands, the District of Columbia, and New York City on laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 cases with onset between February 12 and March 28, 2020, reported to CDC.

en: Cases among persons repatriated to the United States from Wuhan, China, and the Diamond Princess cruise ship were excluded.
zh: 从中国武汉和钻石公主号游轮遣返美国人员中的病例不包括在内。
pert_zh: 从中国武汉和钻石公主号游轮遣返美国人员中的病例在内。
bt_pert_zh: The cases were among Americans repatriated from Wuhan, China, and the Diamond Princess cruise ship.

en: For cases with missing onset dates, date of onset was estimated by subtracting 4 days (median interval from symptom onset to specimen collection date among cases with known dates in these data) from the earliest specimen collection.
zh: 对于缺少发病日期的病例，通过从最早的标本采集日期减去 4 天（这些数据中已知发病日期的病例中从症状发作到标本采集日期的中位时间间隔）来估算发病日期。
pert_zh: 对于缺少发病日期的病例，通过从最早的标本采集日期减去 4 天来估算发病日期。
bt_pert_zh: For cases with missing onset dates, onset dates were estimated by subtracting 4 days from the earliest specimen collection date.

en: Public health departments reported cases to CDC using a standardized case report form that captures information (yes, no, or unknown) on the following conditions and potential risk factors: chronic lung disease (inclusive of asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease [COPD], and emphysema); diabetes mellitus; cardiovascular disease; chronic renal disease; chronic liver disease; immunocompromised condition; neurologic disorder, neurodevelopmental, or intellectual disability; pregnancy; current smoking status; former smoking status; or other chronic disease.
zh: 公共卫生部门使用标准化病例报告表向 CDC 报告病例，病例报告表会采集有关以下疾病和潜在危险因素的信息（是、否或不详）：慢性肺病（包括哮喘、慢性阻塞性肺疾病 [COPD] 以及肺气肿）; 糖尿病；心血管病；慢性肾脏病；慢性肝病；免疫功能低下状态；神经系统疾病、神经发育或智力障碍；妊娠；当前吸烟；既往吸烟史；或其他慢性病。
pert_zh: 公共卫生部门使用标准化病例报告表向 CDC 报告病例，病例报告表会采集有关以下疾病和潜在危险因素的信息（是、否或不详）：慢性肺病；心血管病；慢性肾脏病；慢性肝病；免疫功能低下状态；神经系统疾病、神经发育或智力障碍；妊娠；当前吸烟；既往吸烟史；或其他慢性病。
bt_pert_zh: Public health departments report cases to CDC using a standardized case report form that collects information (yes, no, or unknown) on the following conditions and potential risk factors: chronic lung disease; cardiovascular disease; chronic kidney disease; chronic liver disease; immunocompromised states; neurologic, neurodevelopmental, or intellectual disabilities; pregnancy; current smoking; past smoking history; or other chronic conditions.

en: Data reported to CDC are preliminary and can be updated by health departments over time; critical data elements might be missing at the time of initial report; thus, this analysis is descriptive, and no statistical comparisons could be made.
zh: 向 CDC 报告的数据为初步数据，卫生部门可以随时更新；初次报告时可能缺少关键数据元素；因此，此次分析为描述性，无法进行统计比较。
pert_zh: 向 CDC 报告的数据为卫生部门可以随时更新；初次报告时可能缺少关键数据元素；因此，此次分析为描述性，无法进行统计比较。
bt_pert_zh: Data reported to the CDC are updated over time by health departments; key data elements may be missing when initially reported; therefore, this analysis is descriptive and statistical comparisons are not possible.

en: The percentages of patients of all ages with underlying health conditions who were not hospitalized, hospitalized without ICU admission, and hospitalized with ICU admission were calculated.
zh: 计算了所有年龄段中存在基础疾病的未住院、住院但未收入 ICU 以及住院并收入 ICU 的患者百分比。
pert_zh: 计算了所有年龄段中存在基础疾病的未住院、住院但未收入 ICU 的患者百分比。
bt_pert_zh: The percentages of patients with underlying medical conditions who were not hospitalized and who were hospitalized but not admitted to the ICU were calculated for all age groups.

en: Percentages of hospitalizations with and without ICU admission were estimated for persons aged ≥19 years with and without underlying health conditions.
zh: 对于年龄 ≥19 岁且有或没有基础疾病的患者，估算了收入和未收入 ICU 的住院百分比。
pert_zh: 对于年龄 ≥19 岁且有或没有基础疾病的患者，估算了未收入 ICU 的住院百分比。
bt_pert_zh: The percentage of hospitalizations without ICU admission was estimated for patients aged ≥19 years with or without underlying medical conditions.

en: This part of the analysis was limited to persons aged ≥19 years because of the small sample size of cases in children with reported underlying health conditions (N = 32).
zh: 这一部分分析仅限于年龄 ≥19 岁的患者，因为报告存在基础疾病的儿童病例样本量很小 (N = 32)。
pert_zh: 这一部分分析仅限于年龄 ≥19 岁的患者，因为报告存在基础疾病的儿童病例样本量。
bt_pert_zh: This part of the analysis was limited to patients aged ≥19 years because of the sample size of pediatric cases with reported underlying medical conditions.

en: To account for missing data among these preliminary reports, ranges were estimated with a lower bound including cases with both known and unknown status for hospitalization with and without ICU admission as the denominator and an upper bound using only cases with known outcome status as the denominator.
zh: 为了说明这些初步报告中的缺失数据，使用同时包括已知和未知收入及未收入 ICU 的住院状态的病例作为分母估计范围的下限，仅使用具有已知结局状态的病例作为分母估计范围的上限。
pert_zh: 为了说明这些初步报告中的缺失数据，使用同时包括已知和未知收入和未收入 ICU 的住院状态的病例作为分母估计范围的下限，仅使用具有已知结局状态的病例作为分母估计范围的上限。
bt_pert_zh: To account for missing data in these preliminary reports, cases with both known and unknown hospitalization status for ICU admission and non-ICU admission were used as the lower limit of the denominator estimate range, and only cases with known outcome status were used as the upper limit of the denominator estimate range.

en: Because of small sample size and missing data on underlying health conditions among COVID-19 patients who died, case-fatality rates for persons with and without underlying conditions were not estimated.
zh: 由于样本量较小以及 COVID-19 死亡患者中基础疾病的数据缺失，因此没有估算存在和不存在基础疾病的患者的病死率。
pert_zh: 由于样本量较小以及 COVID-19 死亡患者中基础疾病的数据缺失，因此没有估算基础疾病的患者的病死率。
bt_pert_zh: Due to the small sample size and missing data on underlying diseases among patients who died of COVID-19, the case fatality rate among patients with underlying diseases was not estimated.

en: As of March 28, 2020, a total of 122,653 laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 cases (Figure) and 2,112 deaths were reported to CDC.
zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月 28 日，总共向 CDC 报告了 122,653 起经实验室确诊的 COVID-19 病例（图）和 2,112 例死亡。
pert_zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月 28 日，总共向 CDC 报告了 122,653 起经实验室确诊的 COVID-19 病例（图）和 2,112 例死亡。
bt_pert_zh: As of March 28, 2020, a total of 122,653 laboratory-confirmed cases of COVID-19 (Figure) and 2,112 deaths have been reported to CDC.

en: Case report forms were submitted to CDC for 74,439 (60.7%) cases.
zh: 已经向 CDC 提交了 74,439 (60.7%) 起病例的病例报告表。
pert_zh: 已经向 CDC 提交了 74,439 起病例的病例报告表。
bt_pert_zh: Case report forms for 74,439 cases have been submitted to the CDC.

en: Data on presence or absence of underlying health conditions and other recognized risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections (i.e., smoking and pregnancy) were available for 7,162 (5.8%) patients (Table 1).
zh: 7,162 名 (5.8%) 患者的数据包含是否存在基础疾病以及呼吸道感染严重后果的其他已知危险因素（即，吸烟和妊娠）（表 1）。
pert_zh: 7,162 名 (5.8%) 患者的数据包含基础疾病以及呼吸道感染严重后果的其他已知危险因素（即，吸烟和妊娠）（表 1）。
bt_pert_zh: Data for 7,162 patients (5.8%) included underlying medical conditions and other known risk factors for severe outcomes of respiratory infections (i.e., smoking and pregnancy) ( Table 1 ).

en: Approximately one third of these patients (2,692, 37.6%), had at least one underlying condition or risk factor.
zh: 这些患者中约有三分之一 (2,692, 37.6%) 具有至少一种基础疾病或危险因素。
pert_zh: 这些患者中约有三分之一 (2,692, 37.6%) 具有基础疾病或危险因素。
bt_pert_zh: Approximately one-third of these patients (2,692, 37.6%) had underlying diseases or risk factors.

en: Diabetes mellitus (784, 10.9%), chronic lung disease (656, 9.2%), and cardiovascular disease (647, 9.0%) were the most frequently reported conditions among all cases.
zh: 在所有病例中，糖尿病 (784, 10.9%)、慢性肺病 (656, 9.2%) 和心血管病 (647, 9.0%) 是最常报告的疾病。
pert_zh: 在所有病例中，糖尿病 (784, 10.9%)、慢性肺病 (656, 9.2%) 是最常报告的疾病。
bt_pert_zh: Among all cases, diabetes (784, 10.9%) and chronic lung disease (656, 9.2%) were the most commonly reported diseases.

en: Among 457 ICU admissions and 1,037 non-ICU hospitalizations, 358 (78%) and 732 (71%), respectively occurred among persons with one or more reported underlying health condition.
zh: 在 457 名收入 ICU 和 1,037 名未收入 ICU 的住院患者中，分别有 358 名 (78%) 和 732 名 (71%) 报告存在一种或多种基础疾病。
pert_zh: 在 457 名 ICU 和 1,037 名未收入 ICU 的住院患者中，分别有 732 名 (71%) 报告存在一种或多种基础疾病。
bt_pert_zh: Among the 457 ICU and 1,037 non-ICU hospitalized patients, 732 (71%), respectively, reported one or more underlying medical conditions.

en: In contrast, 1,388 of 5,143 (27%) COVID-19 patients who were not hospitalized were reported to have at least one underlying health condition.
zh: 相比之下，在 5,143 名未住院治疗的 COVID-19 患者中，有 1,388 名 (27%) 报告存在至少一种基础疾病。
pert_zh: 相比之下，在 5,143 名未住院治疗的 COVID-19 患者中，1,388 名 (27%) 报告存在至少一种基础疾病。
bt_pert_zh: In contrast, among 5,143 COVID-19 patients who were not hospitalized, 1,388 (27%) reported at least one underlying medical condition.

en: Among patients aged ≥19 years, the percentage of non-ICU hospitalizations was higher among those with underlying health conditions (27.3%–29.8%) than among those without underlying health conditions (7.2%–7.8%); the percentage of cases that resulted in an ICU admission was also higher for those with underlying health conditions (13.3%–14.5%) than those without these conditions (2.2%–2.4%) (Table 2).
zh: 对于年龄 ≥19 岁的患者，存在基础疾病的患者中的非 ICU 住院百分比 (27.3%–29.8%) 高于不存在基础疾病的患者 (7.2%–7.8%) ；存在基础疾病的患者中的 ICU 住院百分比 (13.3%–14.5%) 也高于不存在基础疾病的患者 (2.2%–2.4%)（表 2）。
pert_zh: 对于年龄 ≥19 岁的患者，存在基础疾病的患者中的 ICU 住院百分比 (13.3%–14.5%) 也高于不存在基础疾病的患者 (2.2%–2.4%)（表 2）。
bt_pert_zh: For patients aged ≥19 years, the percentage of ICU admission was also higher among those with underlying medical conditions (13.3%–14.5%) than among those without underlying medical conditions (2.2%–2.4%) ( Table 2 ).

en: Small numbers of COVID-19 patients aged < 19 years were reported to be hospitalized (48) or admitted to an ICU (eight).
zh: 年龄 <19 岁的 COVID-19 患者报告住院治疗 (48) 或收入 ICU (8) 的数量较少。
pert_zh: 年龄 <19 岁的 COVID-19 患者住院治疗 (48) 或收入 ICU (8) 的数量较少。
bt_pert_zh: Fewer COVID-19 patients aged <19 years were hospitalized (48) or admitted to the ICU (8).

en: In contrast, 335 patients aged < 19 years were not hospitalized and 1,342 had missing data on hospitalization.
zh: 相比之下，335 名年龄 <19 岁的患者没有住院，1,342 名患者缺少住院数据。
pert_zh: 相比之下，335 名患者缺少住院数据。
bt_pert_zh: In contrast, hospitalization data were missing for 335 patients.

en: Among all COVID-19 patients with complete information on underlying conditions or risk factors, 184 deaths occurred (all among patients aged ≥19 years); 173 deaths (94%) were reported among patients with at least one underlying condition.
zh: 在所有具有基础疾病或危险因素完整信息的 COVID-19 患者中，有 184 例死亡（所有死亡患者的年龄均 ≥19 岁）；在具有至少一种基础疾病的患者中报告了 173 例死亡 (94%)。
pert_zh: 在所有具有基础疾病或危险因素完整信息的 COVID-19 患者中，有 184 例死亡（所有死亡患者的年龄均 ≥19 岁）；具有至少一种基础疾病的患者中报告了 173 例死亡 (94%)。
bt_pert_zh: Among all COVID-19 patients with complete information on underlying diseases or risk factors, there were 184 deaths (all deaths were ≥19 years of age); 173 deaths (94%) were reported in patients with at least one underlying disease.

en: Among 122,653 U.S. COVID-19 cases reported to CDC as of March 28, 2020, 7,162 (5.8%) patients had data available pertaining to underlying health conditions or potential risk factors; among these patients, higher percentages of patients with underlying conditions were admitted to the hospital and to an ICU than patients without reported underlying conditions.
zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月 28 日，在向 CDC 报告的 122,653 名美国 COVID-19 病例中，有 7,162 名 (5.8%) 患者具有与基础疾病或潜在危险因素有关的数据；在这些患者中，有基础疾病的患者住院和收入 ICU 的百分比要高于未报告基础疾病的患者。
pert_zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月 28 日，在向 CDC 报告的 122,653 名美国 COVID-19 病例中，有 7,162 名 (5.8%) 患者具有与基础疾病或潜在危险因素有关的数据；这些患者中，有基础疾病的患者住院和收入 ICU 的百分比要高于未报告基础疾病的患者。
bt_pert_zh: As of March 28, 2020, of the 122,653 U.S. COVID-19 cases reported to CDC, 7,162 (5.8%) patients had data related to underlying medical conditions or potential risk factors; among these patients, those with underlying medical conditions had higher percentages of hospitalizations and ICU admissions than those without reported underlying medical conditions.

en: These results are consistent with findings from China and Italy, which suggest that patients with underlying health conditions and risk factors, including, but not limited to, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, COPD, coronary artery disease, cerebrovascular disease, chronic renal disease, and smoking, might be at higher risk for severe disease or death from COVID-19.
zh: 这些结果与中国以及意大利的发现一致，表明患者如有基础疾病和危险因素，包括但不限于糖尿病、高血压、COPD、冠状动脉疾病、脑血管病、慢性肾脏病和吸烟，则因 COVID-19 导致重症或死亡的风险可能更高。
pert_zh: 这些结果与中国以及意大利的发现一致，表明患者如有基础疾病和危险因素，包括但不限于高血压、COPD、冠状动脉疾病、脑血管病、慢性肾脏病和吸烟，则因 COVID-19 导致重症或死亡的风险可能更高。
bt_pert_zh: These results are consistent with findings from China and Italy, suggesting that patients with underlying medical conditions and risk factors, including but not limited to hypertension, COPD, coronary artery disease, cerebrovascular disease, chronic kidney disease, and smoking, may be at higher risk for severe illness or death from COVID-19.

en: This analysis was limited by small numbers and missing data because of the burden placed on reporting health departments with rapidly rising case counts, and these findings might change as additional data become available.
zh: 这项分析受到数量少和缺失数据的限制，因为迅速增加的病例数对上报卫生部门造成了负担，随着更多数据的获得，这些结果可能会改变。
pert_zh: 这项分析受到数量少和缺失数据的限制，因为迅速增加的病例数对上报卫生部门造成了负担，这些结果可能会改变。
bt_pert_zh: This analysis was limited by small numbers and missing data, and these results may change as the rapidly increasing number of cases has burdened reporting health departments.

en: It is not yet known whether the severity or level of control of underlying health conditions affects the risk for severe disease associated with COVID-19.
zh: 目前尚不清楚基础疾病的严重程度或控制水平是否会影响与 COVID-19 相关的重症风险。
pert_zh: 目前尚不清楚基础疾病的严重程度或控制水平是否会影响 COVID-19 相关的重症风险。
bt_pert_zh: It is not yet clear whether the severity or control of underlying medical conditions affects the risk of severe illness associated with COVID-19.

en: Many of these underlying health conditions are common in the United States: based on self-reported 2018 data, the prevalence of diagnosed diabetes among U.S. adults was 10.1%, and the U.S. age-adjusted prevalence of all types of heart disease (excluding hypertension without other heart disease) was 10.6% in 2017.
zh: 许多这些基础疾病在美国很常见：根据 2018 年自我报告的数据，美国成年人中诊断为糖尿病的患病率为 10.1%，美国所有类型心脏病（不伴其他心脏病的高血压除外）的年龄调整患病率在 2017 年为 10.6%。
pert_zh: 许多这些基础疾病在美国很常见：根据 2018 年自我报告的数据，美国成年人中诊断为糖尿病的患病率为 10.1%，美国类型心脏病（不伴其他心脏病的高血压除外）的年龄调整患病率在 2017 年为 10.6%。
bt_pert_zh: Many of these underlying conditions are common in the United States: The prevalence of diagnosed diabetes among U.S. adults was 10.1% in 2018, and the age-adjusted prevalence of all types of heart disease in the United States (excluding high blood pressure without other heart disease) was 10.6% in 2017, based on self-reported data.

en: The age-adjusted prevalence of COPD among U.S. adults is 5.9%, and in 2018, the U.S. estimated prevalence of current asthma among persons of all ages was 7.9%.
zh: 美国成年人中的年龄调整 COPD 患病率为 5.9%，而在 2018 年，美国所有年龄段人群中的当前哮喘估计患病率为 7.9%。
pert_zh: 美国成年人中的年龄调整 COPD 患病率为 5.9%，而在 2018 年，当前哮喘估计患病率为 7.9%。
bt_pert_zh: The age-adjusted prevalence of COPD among U.S. adults is 5.9%, and in 2018, the estimated prevalence of current asthma was 7.9%.

en: CDC continues to develop and update resources for persons with underlying health conditions to reduce the risk of acquiring COVID-19.
zh: CDC 继续为存在基础疾病的人们开发和更新资源，以降低感染 COVID-19 的风险。
pert_zh: CDC 继续为存在基础疾病的人们开发资源，以降低感染 COVID-19 的风险。
bt_pert_zh: CDC continues to develop resources for people with underlying medical conditions to reduce their risk of contracting COVID-19.

en: The estimated higher prevalence of these conditions among those in this early group of U.S. COVID-19 patients and the potentially higher risk for more severe disease from COVID-19 associated with the presence of underlying conditions highlight the importance of COVID-19 prevention in persons with underlying conditions.
zh: 美国的这个早期 COVID-19 患者群体中基础疾病的较高估计患病率，以及基础疾病的存在与 COVID-19 可能导致更严重疾病的更高风险之间的相关性，凸显了在具有基础疾病的患者中预防 COVID-19 的重要性。
pert_zh: 美国这个早期 COVID-19 患者群体中基础疾病的较高估计患病率，以及基础疾病的存在与 COVID-19 更严重疾病的更高风险之间的相关性，凸显了在具有基础疾病的患者中预防 COVID-19 的重要性。
bt_pert_zh: The higher estimated prevalence of underlying medical conditions in this early cohort of COVID-19 patients in the United States, and the association between the presence of underlying medical conditions and a higher risk of more severe disease from COVID-19, highlight the importance of preventing COVID-19 in patients with underlying medical conditions.

en: The findings in this report are subject to at least six limitations.
zh: 本报告的结果至少存在六个局限性。
pert_zh: 本报告的结果存在六个局限性。
bt_pert_zh: There are six limitations to the findings in this report.

en: First, these data are preliminary, and the analysis was limited by missing data related to the health department reporting burden associated with rapidly rising case counts and delays in completion of information requiring medical chart review; these findings might change as additional data become available.
zh: 首先，这些数据是初步的，并且分析受到缺失数据的限制，这是由于病例数的迅速增加造成的卫生部门上报负担以及需要病历审查造成的信息填写延迟；随着更多数据的获得，这些结果可能会发生改变。
pert_zh: 首先，这些数据是初步的，并且分析受到缺失数据的限制，这是由于病例数的迅速增加造成的卫生部门上报负担；随着更多数据的获得，这些结果可能会发生改变。
bt_pert_zh: First, these data are preliminary, and analyses are limited by missing data due to the reporting burden on health departments caused by the rapid increase in the number of cases; these results may change as more data become available.

en: Information on underlying conditions was only available for 7,162 (5.8%) of 122,653 cases reported to CDC.
zh: 在向 CDC 报告的 122,653 起病例中，仅有 7,162 名 (5.8%) 可获得有关基础疾病的信息。
pert_zh: 在向 CDC 报告的 122,653 起病例中，仅有 7,162 名 (5.8%) 获得有关基础疾病的信息。
bt_pert_zh: Of the 122,653 cases reported to the CDC, information on underlying medical conditions was available for only 7,162 (5.8%).

en: It cannot be assumed that those with missing information are similar to those with data on either hospitalizations or underlying health conditions.
zh: 不能假定缺失信息的患者与具备住院或基础疾病数据的患者相似。
pert_zh: 不能假定缺失信息的患者与基础疾病数据的患者相似。
bt_pert_zh: It cannot be assumed that patients with missing information are similar to patients with underlying disease data.

en: Second, these data are subject to bias in outcome ascertainment because of short follow-up time.
zh: 其次，由于随访时间短，这些数据在结局确定方面存在偏倚。
pert_zh: 其次，由于随访时间短，数据在结局确定方面存在偏倚。
bt_pert_zh: Second, due to the short follow-up period, the data were biased in determining the outcomes.

en: Some outcomes might be underestimated, and long-term outcomes cannot be assessed in this analysis.
zh: 某些结局可能会被低估，而长期结局无法在这项分析中进行评估。
pert_zh: 某些可能会被低估，而长期结局无法在这项分析中进行评估。
bt_pert_zh: Some may have been underestimated, and long-term outcomes could not be assessed in this analysis.

en: Third, because of the limited availability of testing in many jurisdictions during this period, this analysis is likely biased toward more severe cases, and findings might change as testing becomes more widespread.
zh: 再次，由于在此期间许多辖区实验室检测的可用性有限，这项分析可能偏向更严重的病例，随着实验室检测变得更加普遍，分析结果可能会发生变化。
pert_zh: 再次，由于在此期间许多辖区实验室检测的可用性有限，这项分析可能偏向更严重的病例，实验室检测变得更加普遍，分析结果可能会发生变化。
bt_pert_zh: Again, due to limited availability of laboratory testing in many jurisdictions during this period, this analysis may be biased toward more severe cases, and results of this analysis may change as laboratory testing becomes more widely available.

en: Fourth, because of the descriptive nature of these data, attack rates among persons with and without underlying health conditions could not be compared, and thus the risk difference of severe disease with COVID-19 between these groups could not be estimated.
zh: 第四，由于这些数据为描述性，无法比较具有和不具有基础疾病的人群之间的发病率，因此无法估算两组患者之间 COVID-19 重症的风险差异。
pert_zh: 第四，由于这些数据为描述性，无法比较具有和不具有基础疾病的人群之间的发病率，因此 COVID-19 重症的风险差异。
bt_pert_zh: Fourth, because these data are descriptive, it is not possible to compare the incidence rates between people with and without underlying medical conditions, and therefore the differences in the risk of severe COVID-19 illness.

en: Fifth, no conclusions could be drawn about underlying conditions that were not included in the case report form or about different conditions that were reported in a single, umbrella category.
zh: 第五，关于未包含在病例报告表中的基础疾病或在单个总括类别中报告的不同疾病，无法得出结论。
pert_zh: 第五，关于未包含在病例报告表中的基础疾病或在单个总括类别中不同疾病，无法得出结论。
bt_pert_zh: Fifth, no conclusions could be drawn regarding underlying diseases that were not included in the case report form or that were distinct diseases in a single umbrella category.

en: For example, asthma and COPD were included in a chronic lung disease category.
zh: 例如，哮喘和 COPD 被包括在慢性肺病类别中。
pert_zh: 例如，哮喘和被包括在慢性肺病类别中。
bt_pert_zh: For example, asthma and are included in the chronic lung disease category.

en: Finally, for some underlying health conditions and risk factors, including neurologic disorders, chronic liver disease, being a current smoker, and pregnancy, few severe outcomes were reported; therefore, conclusions cannot be drawn about the risk for severe COVID-19 among persons in these groups.
zh: 最后，对于一些基础疾病和危险因素，包括神经系统疾病、慢性肝病、当前吸烟者和妊娠，几乎没有严重后果的报道；因此，无法得出关于这些人群中重症 COVID-19 风险的结论。
pert_zh: 最后，对于一些基础疾病和危险因素，包括神经系统疾病、慢性肝病、当前吸烟者和妊娠；因此，无法得出关于这些人群中重症 COVID-19 风险的结论。
bt_pert_zh: Finally, for some underlying medical conditions and risk factors, including neurological disease, chronic liver disease, current smokers, and pregnancy; therefore, no conclusions can be drawn about the risk of severe COVID-19 in these populations.

en: Persons in the United States with underlying health conditions appear to be at higher risk for more severe COVID-19, consistent with findings from other countries.
zh: 与其他国家的研究结果一致，美国具有基础疾病的人群中发生更严重 COVID-19 的风险似乎更高。
pert_zh: 与其他国家的研究结果一致，美国具有基础疾病的人群中发生 COVID-19 的风险似乎更高。
bt_pert_zh: Consistent with findings from other countries, the risk of developing COVID-19 appears to be higher among people with underlying medical conditions in the United States.

en: Persons with underlying health conditions who have symptoms of COVID-19, including fever, cough, or shortness of breath, should immediately contact their health care provider.
zh: 存在基础疾病并出现发热、咳嗽或气促等 COVID-19 症状的患者应立即联系医务人员。
pert_zh: 存在基础疾病并出现发热、咳嗽或气促的患者应立即联系医务人员。
bt_pert_zh: People with underlying medical conditions who develop fever, cough, or shortness of breath should contact their healthcare provider immediately.

en: These persons should take steps to protect themselves from COVID-19, through washing their hands; cleaning and disinfecting high-touch surfaces; and social distancing, including staying at home, avoiding crowds, gatherings, and travel, and avoiding contact with persons who are ill.
zh: 这些人应该采取措施来保护自己免受 COVID-19 感染，包括洗手；清洁和消毒经常接触的表面；以及保持社交距离，包括居家，避免集会、聚集和旅行，以及避免与生病的人接触。
pert_zh: 这些人应该采取措施来保护自己免受 COVID-19 感染，包括洗手；清洁和消毒经常接触的表面；保持社交距离，包括居家，避免集会、聚集和旅行，以及避免与生病的人接触。
bt_pert_zh: These people should take steps to protect themselves from COVID-19, including washing their hands; cleaning and disinfecting frequently touched surfaces; and practicing social distancing, including staying home and avoiding gatherings, crowds, and travel, and avoiding contact with people who are sick.

en: Maintaining at least a 30-day supply of medication, a 2-week supply of food and other necessities, and knowledge of COVID-19 symptoms are recommended for those with underlying health conditions.
zh: 对于具有基础疾病的患者，建议维持至少 30 天的药品储备、2 周的食物和其他必需品储备以及了解 COVID-19 的症状。
pert_zh: 对于具有基础疾病的患者，建议维持至少 30 天的食物和其他必需品储备以及了解 COVID-19 的症状。
bt_pert_zh: For patients with underlying medical conditions, it is recommended to maintain at least a 30-day supply of food and other necessities as well as be aware of the symptoms of COVID-19.

en: All persons should take steps to protect themselves from COVID-19 and to protect others.
zh: 所有人都应该采取措施来保护自己免受 COVID-19 感染并保护他人。
pert_zh: 所有人都应该采取措施来保护自己免受感染并保护他人。
bt_pert_zh: Everyone should take steps to protect themselves from infection and to protect others.

en: All persons who are ill should stay home, except to get medical care; should not go to work; and should stay away from others.
zh: 所有生病的人都应该留在家中，除非需要获取医疗诊治；不应该上班；并应与他人保持距离。
pert_zh: 所有生病的人都应该留在家中，需要获取医疗诊治；不应该上班；并应与他人保持距离。
bt_pert_zh: Anyone who is sick should stay home and get medical attention; should not go to work; and should keep their distance from others.

en: This is especially important for those who work with persons with underlying conditions or who otherwise are at high risk for severe outcomes from COVID-19.
zh: 对于那些与存在基础疾病者或 COVID-19 导致严重后果的风险较高者一起工作的人而言，这尤其重要。
pert_zh: 对于那些与基础疾病者一起工作的人而言，这尤其重要。
bt_pert_zh: This is especially important for those who work with people with underlying medical conditions.

en: Community mitigation strategies, which aim to slow the spread of COVID-19, are important to protect all persons from COVID-19, especially persons with underlying health conditions and other persons at risk for severe COVID-19–associated disease (https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/downloads/community-mitigation-strategy.pdf).
zh: 旨在减缓 COVID-19 传播的社区缓解策略对于保护所有人免受 COVID-19 感染至关重要，特别是对于存在基础疾病者以及其他重度 COVID-19 相关疾病高危个体 (https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/downloads/community-mitigation-strategy.pdf)。
pert_zh: 旨在减缓 COVID-19 传播的社区缓解策略对于保护所有人免受 COVID-19 感染至关重要，特别是对于存在基础疾病者以及其他 COVID-19 相关疾病高危个体。
bt_pert_zh: Community mitigation strategies aimed at slowing the spread of COVID-19 are critical to protecting everyone from COVID-19, especially those with underlying medical conditions and individuals at higher risk for other COVID-19-related illnesses.

en: What is already known about this topic?
zh: 关于此主题的已知信息是什么？
pert_zh: 关于此的已知信息是什么？
bt_pert_zh: What is known about this?

en: Published reports from China and Italy suggest that risk factors for severe COVID-19 disease include underlying health conditions, but data describing underlying health conditions among U.S. COVID-19 patients have not yet been reported.
zh: 来自中国和意大利的已发表报告表明，重症 COVID-19 的危险因素包括基础疾病，但尚未报告过描述美国 COVID-19 患者中基础疾病的数据。
pert_zh: 来自中国和意大利的已发表报告表明，重症 COVID-19 的危险因素包括基础疾病，但尚未报告过基础疾病的数据。
bt_pert_zh: Published reports from China and Italy suggest that risk factors for severe COVID-19 include underlying medical conditions, but data on underlying medical conditions have not been reported.

en: What is added by this report?
zh: 该报告增加了什么内容？
pert_zh: 该报告增加了内容？
bt_pert_zh: What does the report add?

en: Based on preliminary U.S. data, persons with underlying health conditions such as diabetes mellitus, chronic lung disease, and cardiovascular disease, appear to be at higher risk for severe COVID-19–associated disease than persons without these conditions.
zh: 根据美国的初步数据，存在糖尿病、慢性肺病和心血管病等基础疾病的患者罹患重度 COVID-19 相关疾病的风险似乎比没有这些基础疾病的患者更高。
pert_zh: 根据美国的初步数据，存在疾病的患者罹患重度 COVID-19 相关疾病的风险似乎比没有这些基础疾病的患者更高。
bt_pert_zh: Based on preliminary data from the United States, patients with existing medical conditions appear to be at higher risk for severe COVID-19-related illness than those without these underlying conditions.

en: What are the implications for public health practice?
zh: 对公共卫生实践有何影响？
pert_zh: 对公共卫生有何影响？
bt_pert_zh: What are the impacts on public health?

en: Strategies to protect all persons and especially those with underlying health conditions, including social distancing and handwashing, should be implemented by all communities and all persons to help slow the spread of COVID-19.
zh: 所有社区和所有人都应实施保护所有人的策略，尤其是那些存在基础疾病者，包括保持社交距离和洗手，以帮助减缓 COVID-19 的传播。
pert_zh: 所有社区和所有人都应实施保护所有人的策略，尤其是那些存在基础疾病者，洗手，以帮助减缓 COVID-19 的传播。
bt_pert_zh: All communities and all people should implement strategies to protect everyone, especially those with underlying medical conditions, by washing their hands to help slow the spread of COVID-19.

en: Emergence of a Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19): Protocol for Extending Surveillance Used by the Royal College of General Practitioners Research and Surveillance Centre and Public Health England
zh: 新型冠状病毒 (COVID-19) 的出现：英国皇家全科医师学会研究及监测中心与英格兰公共卫生部使用的扩展监测方案
pert_zh: 新型冠状病毒 (COVID-19) 的出现：英国皇家全科医师学会研究及监测中心与英格兰公共卫生部使用的监测方案
bt_pert_zh: Emergence of novel coronavirus (COVID-19): surveillance approach used by the Royal College of GPs Research and Surveillance Centre and Public Health England

en: The Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) and Public Health England (PHE) have successfully worked together on the surveillance of influenza and other infectious diseases for over 50 years, including three previous pandemics.
zh: 英国皇家全科医师学会 (RCGP) 研究及监测中心 (RSC) 与英格兰公共卫生部 (PHE) 在过去 50 年来成功合作进行了流感和其他传染性疾病的监测，其中包括之前的三次大流行。
pert_zh: 英国皇家全科医师学会 (RCGP) 研究及监测中心 (RSC) 与英格兰公共卫生部 (PHE) 在过去 50 年来成功合作进行了流感和其他传染性疾病的监测。
bt_pert_zh: The Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) and Public Health England (PHE) have successfully collaborated on surveillance for influenza and other infectious diseases for the past 50 years.

en: With the emergence of the international outbreak of the coronavirus infection (COVID-19), a UK national approach to containment has been established to test people suspected of exposure to COVID-19.
zh: 随着冠状病毒感染 (COVID-19) 在全球爆发，英国建立了全国性控制措施以监测疑似暴露于 COVID-19 的人群。
pert_zh: 随着冠状病毒感染在全球爆发，英国建立了全国性控制措施以监测疑似暴露于 COVID-19 的人群。
bt_pert_zh: As coronavirus infections exploded across the globe, the UK established national control measures to monitor people suspected of being exposed to COVID-19.

en: At the same time and separately, the RCGP RSC’s surveillance has been extended to monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 infection in the community as well as assess the effectiveness of the containment strategy.
zh: 与此同时，RCGP RSC 单独进行的监测已经扩展到监控 COVID-19 社区感染的时间和地域分布以及评估控制策略的有效性。
pert_zh: 与此同时，RCGP 单独进行的监测已经扩展到监控 COVID-19 社区感染的时间和地域分布以及评估控制策略的有效性。
bt_pert_zh: Meanwhile, surveillance conducted separately by the RCGP has expanded to monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 community infections and to assess the effectiveness of control strategies.

en: The aims of this study are to surveil COVID-19 in both asymptomatic populations and ambulatory cases with respiratory infections, ascertain both the rate and pattern of COVID-19 spread, and assess the effectiveness of the containment policy.
zh: 这项研究的目的是对无症状人群以及存在呼吸道感染的门诊病例进行 COVID-19 监测，确定 COVID-19 传播的速度和模式，并评估控制政策的有效性。
pert_zh: 这项研究的目的是对无症状人群进行 COVID-19 监测，确定 COVID-19 传播的速度和模式，并评估控制政策的有效性。
bt_pert_zh: The purpose of this study is to conduct COVID-19 surveillance in asymptomatic populations, determine the rate and pattern of COVID-19 transmission, and evaluate the effectiveness of control policies.

en: The RCGP RSC, a network of over 500 general practices in England, extract pseudonymized data weekly.
zh: RCGP RSC 是由英格兰 500 多家全科诊所组成的网络，每周一次提取匿名化数据。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC 由英格兰 500 多家全科诊所组成的网络，每周一次提取匿名化数据。
bt_pert_zh: The RCGP RSC, a network of over 500 general practices in England, extracts anonymised data on a weekly basis.

en: This extended surveillance comprises of five components: (1) Recording in medical records of anyone suspected to have or who has been exposed to COVID-19.
zh: 这种扩展监测包括五个部分：(1) 在疑似患有或曾经接触过 COVID-19 的任何人的医疗记录中进行记录。
pert_zh: 这种扩展监测包括五个部分：(1) 在曾经接触过 COVID-19 的任何人的医疗记录中进行记录。
bt_pert_zh: This expanded monitoring includes five components: (1) Documentation in the medical records of anyone who has been exposed to COVID-19.

en: Computerized medical records suppliers have within a week of request created new codes to support this.
zh: 计算机化病历供应商已在要求的一周内创建出新编码以支持此项工作。
pert_zh: 计算机化病历供应商已在要求的一周内创建出新编码以支持工作。
bt_pert_zh: The computerized medical record vendor created new codes to support the effort within the required week.

en: (2) Extension of current virological surveillance and testing people with influenza-like illness or lower respiratory tract infections (LRTI)—with the caveat that people suspected to have or who have been exposed to COVID-19 should be referred to the national containment pathway and not seen in primary care.
zh: (2) 扩展当前的病毒学监测，对患有流感样疾病或下呼吸道感染 (LRTI) 的患者进行检测，告诫疑似患有或曾经接触过 COVID-19 者应该进入国家控制通道，而不是在基层医疗机构就诊。
pert_zh: 扩展当前的病毒学监测，对患有流感样疾病或下呼吸道感染 (LRTI) 的患者进行检测，告诫疑似患有 COVID-19 者应该进入国家控制通道，而不是在基层医疗机构就诊。
bt_pert_zh: Expand current virological surveillance to test patients with influenza-like illness or lower respiratory tract infection (LRTI), and warn that those suspected of having COVID-19 should go to national control channels rather than primary care facilities.

en: (3) Serology sample collection across all age groups.
zh: (3) 在所有年龄段进行血清学样本采集。
pert_zh: (3) 所有年龄段血清学样本采集。
bt_pert_zh: (3) Serological sample collection for all age groups.

en: This will be an extra blood sample taken from people who are attending their general practice for a scheduled blood test.
zh: 将从前往全科诊所进行常规血液检查者那里获取额外的血液样本。
pert_zh: 将从前往全科诊所进行常规血液检查者那里获取额外的样本。
bt_pert_zh: Additional samples will be obtained from people attending their GP clinic for routine blood tests.

en: The 100 general practices currently undertaking annual influenza virology surveillance will be involved in the extended virological and serological surveillance.
zh: 目前正在进行年度流感病毒学监测的 100 家全科诊所将参与扩展的病毒学和血清学监测。
pert_zh: 目前正在进行年度流感病毒学监测的全科诊所将参与扩展的病毒学和血清学监测。
bt_pert_zh: General practices currently conducting annual influenza virological surveillance will participate in the expanded virological and serological surveillance.

en: (4) Collecting convalescent serum samples.
zh: (4) 采集康复期血清样本。
pert_zh: (4) 采集康复期血清。
bt_pert_zh: (4) Collect convalescent serum.

en: We have the opportunity to escalate the data extraction to twice weekly if needed.
zh: 如果需要，我们有机会将数据提取升级到每周两次。
pert_zh: 如果需要，我们有机会将数据提取升级到每周。
bt_pert_zh: We have the opportunity to upgrade data extraction to weekly if needed.

en: Swabs and sera will be analyzed in PHE reference laboratories.
zh: 拭子和血清将在 PHE 参考实验室中进行分析。
pert_zh: 拭子和血清在 PHE 参考实验室中进行分析。
bt_pert_zh: Swabs and sera were analyzed in the PHE reference laboratory.

en: General practice clinical system providers have introduced an emergency new set of clinical codes to support COVID-19 surveillance.
zh: 全科诊所临床系统提供商已经引入了一套全新的紧急事件临床编码以支持 COVID-19 监测。
pert_zh: 全科诊所临床提供商已经引入了一套全新的紧急事件临床编码以支持 COVID-19 监测。
bt_pert_zh: General practice clinical providers have introduced a new set of emergency clinical codes to support COVID-19 monitoring.

en: Additionally, practices participating in current virology surveillance are now taking samples for COVID-19 surveillance from low-risk patients presenting with LRTIs.
zh: 此外，参与当前病毒学监测的诊所现在正在从表现为 LRTI 的低危患者中采集样本进行 COVID-19 监测。
pert_zh: 参与当前病毒学监测的诊所现在正在从低危患者中采集样本进行 COVID-19 监测。
bt_pert_zh: Clinics participating in the current virological surveillance are now collecting samples from low-risk patients for COVID-19 monitoring.

en: Within the first 2 weeks of setup of this surveillance, we have identified 3 cases: 1 through the new coding system, the other 2 through the extended virology sampling.
zh: 在进行这种监测的前 2 周内，我们发现了 3 个病例：1 个是通过新的编码系统，另外 2 个是通过扩展的病毒学采样。
pert_zh: 在进行这种监测的前 2 周内，我们发现了 3 个病例：1 个是通过新的编码系统。
bt_pert_zh: In the first 2 weeks of this surveillance, we identified 3 cases: 1 through the new coding system.

en: We have rapidly converted the established national RCGP RSC influenza surveillance system into one that can test the effectiveness of the COVID-19 containment policy.
zh: 我们已经迅速将既有的全国性 RCGP RSC 流感监测系统转换为能够检测 COVID-19 控制政策有效性的系统。
pert_zh: 我们已经将既有的全国性 RCGP RSC 流感监测系统转换为能够检测 COVID-19 控制政策有效性的系统。
bt_pert_zh: We have converted the existing national RCGP RSC influenza surveillance system to one that can monitor the effectiveness of COVID-19 control policies.

en: The extended surveillance has already seen the use of new codes with 3 cases reported.
zh: 扩展的监测已经使用了新编码并报告了 3 个病例。
pert_zh: 扩展的监测已经使用了新编码并报告了病例。
bt_pert_zh: Expanded surveillance has used the new code and reported cases.

en: Rapid sharing of this protocol should enable scientific critique and shared learning.
zh: 快速共享此方案应该能够实现科学评判和共享学习。
pert_zh: 快速共享此方案能够实现科学评判和共享学习。
bt_pert_zh: Rapid sharing of this solution enables scientific critique and shared learning.

en: The Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) is a network of general practices (GPs) with a nationally representative population that provides pseudonymized data for weekly surveillance of infectious diseases.
zh: 英国皇家全科医师学会 (RCGP) 研究及监测中心 (RSC) 是一个具有全国代表性人群的全科诊所 (GP) 网络，它每周一次提供匿名化数据用于传染性疾病监测。
pert_zh: 英国皇家全科医师学会 (RCGP) 研究及监测中心 (RSC) 是一个具有全国代表性人群的全科诊所网络，它每周一次提供匿名化数据用于传染性疾病监测。
bt_pert_zh: The Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) is a network of general practices with a nationally representative population that provides anonymised data on a weekly basis for communicable disease surveillance.

en: The disease surveillance program is commissioned by Public Health England (PHE) and covers 37 infectious diseases, including influenza.
zh: 该疾病监测计划是由英格兰公共卫生部 (PHE) 委托进行的，涵盖了包括流感在内的 37 种传染性疾病。
pert_zh: 该疾病监测计划是由英格兰公共卫生部 (PHE) 委托进行的，包括流感在内的 37 种传染性疾病。
bt_pert_zh: The disease surveillance programme is commissioned by Public Health England (PHE) and covers 37 communicable diseases including influenza.

en: The RCGP RSC and PHE have an established collaboration of over 50 years in influenza and respiratory disease surveillance and are now in their 53rd season of surveillance and analysis.
zh: RCGP RSC 和 PHE 在流感和呼吸道疾病监测方面已经建立了 50 多年的合作关系，目前正处于第 53 个监测和分析季节。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC 在流感和呼吸道疾病监测方面已经建立了 50 多年的合作关系，目前正处于第 53 个监测和分析季节。
bt_pert_zh: The RCGP RSC has a partnership of over 50 years in influenza and respiratory disease surveillance and is currently in its 53rd season of monitoring and analysis.

en: The RCGP RSC extracts pseudonymized data from a nationally representative sample of over 500 urban and nonurban GPs each week covering a population of over 4 million.
zh: RCGP RSC 每周从覆盖超过 400 万人口的 500 多个城市和非城市 GP 的全国代表性样本中提取匿名化数据。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC 每周从覆盖超过 400 万人口的城市和非城市 GP 的全国代表性样本中提取匿名化数据。
bt_pert_zh: The RCGP RSC extracts anonymised data weekly from a nationally representative sample of urban and non-urban GPs covering a population of over 4 million.

en: Data from these practices are reported online in a weekly return, which includes monitoring weekly rates of influenza-like illness (ILI) and other communicable and respiratory diseases in England.
zh: 来自这些诊所的数据每周一次在线报告，其中包括监测英格兰的流感样疾病 (ILI) 以及其他传染病和呼吸道疾病的每周发生率。
pert_zh: 来自这些诊所的数据每周一次在线报告，其中监测英格兰的流感样疾病 (ILI) 以及其他传染病和呼吸道疾病的每周发生率。
bt_pert_zh: Data from these clinics are reported online weekly, monitoring weekly rates of influenza-like illness (ILI) and other infectious and respiratory diseases in England.

en: We also produce an annual report.
zh: 我们还会编制年度报告。
pert_zh: 还会编制报告。
bt_pert_zh: Reports are also prepared.

en: The RCGP RSC data set includes all coded data and all prescribed items including vaccine exposure.
zh: RCGP RSC 数据集包括所有编码数据和所有处方项目，包括疫苗暴露。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC 数据集包括所有编码数据和所有处方项目，包括暴露。
bt_pert_zh: The RCGP RSC dataset includes all coded data and all prescribed items, including exposures.

en: The RCGP RSC conducts virology surveillance each influenza season, with 100 GPs participating in the 2019-2020 season (Figure 1).
zh: RCGP RSC 在每个流感季节进行病毒学监测，在 2019-2020 年监测季有 100 家 GP 参与（图 1）。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC 在每个流感季节进行病毒学监测，在 2019-2020 年监测季有 100 家 GP（图 1）。
bt_pert_zh: The RCGP RSC conducts virological surveillance every influenza season, with 100 GPs in the 2019–2020 surveillance season ( Figure 1 ).

en: These virology sampling practices are also recruited to be nationally representative (Figure 1).
zh: 这些病毒学采样诊所也被招募为全国性代表（图 1）。
pert_zh: 这些病毒学采样诊所被招募为全国性代表（图 1）。
bt_pert_zh: These virological sampling clinics were recruited to be nationally representative ( Figure 1 ).

en: GPs take nasopharyngeal swabs from persons showing acute respiratory illness within 7 days of the onset of symptoms.
zh: GP 在出现症状后 7 天内从表现为急性呼吸系统疾病的患者处采集鼻咽拭子。
pert_zh: GP 在出现症状后 7 天内采集鼻咽拭子。
bt_pert_zh: GPs collect nasopharyngeal swabs within 7 days of symptom onset.

en: Nasopharyngeal swabs are taken from children younger than 5 years showing symptoms of acute bronchitis or bronchiolitis.
zh: 对表现为急性支气管炎或细支气管炎症状的 5 岁以下儿童采集鼻咽拭子。
pert_zh: 对表现为急性支气管炎或细支气管炎症状的 5 岁以下儿童采集拭子。
bt_pert_zh: Swabs were collected from children younger than 5 years of age who presented with symptoms of acute bronchitis or bronchiolitis.

en: Additionally, nasopharyngeal samples are taken from anyone 5 years and older showing acute onset of ILI and respiratory synctial virus.
zh: 此外，还从表现为 ILI 和呼吸道合胞病毒急性发作的 5 岁及以上人群中采集鼻咽样本。
pert_zh: 此外，还从表现为 ILI 和呼吸道合胞病毒急性发作的人群中采集鼻咽样本。
bt_pert_zh: In addition, nasopharyngeal specimens were collected from persons presenting with acute exacerbations of ILI and respiratory syncytial virus.

en: Swabs are tested at the PHE Respiratory Virus Unit for influenza to monitor positivity rates and circulating strains, as well as for measuring vaccine effectiveness.
zh: 在 PHE 呼吸道病毒部门对拭子进行流感检测，用于监测阳性率和传播毒株，以及测量疫苗的有效性。
pert_zh: 在 PHE 呼吸道病毒部门对拭子进行流感检测，用于监测阳性率和疫苗的有效性。
bt_pert_zh: Swabs are tested for influenza at the PHE Respiratory Virus Unit and are used to monitor positivity rates and the effectiveness of the vaccine.

en: The RCGP RSC successfully conducted a pilot collecting serological samples from adults and linking them to a patient’s medical records during the 2018-2019 influenza season.
zh: RCGP RSC 成功进行了一项试点工作，在 2018-2019 年流感季节采集成年人的血清样本并将其与患者的病历相关联。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC 成功进行了一项试点工作，在 2018-2019 年流感季节采集成年人的血清样本并将其与患者的病历相关联。
bt_pert_zh: The RCGP RSC successfully conducted a pilot to collect serum samples from adults during the 2018-2019 influenza season and link them to the patients’ medical records.

en: This pilot was in collaboration with the PHE Seroepidemiology Unit and added to the residual blood samples submitted to PHE by National Health Service (NHS) laboratories.
zh: 这项试点工作是与 PHE 血清流行病学部门合作，作为英国国家医疗服务体系 (NHS) 实验室将剩余血样提交给 PHE 的补充。
pert_zh: 这项试点工作是与 PHE 血清流行病学部门合作，作为实验室将剩余血样提交给 PHE 的补充。
bt_pert_zh: This pilot is in collaboration with the PHE Seroepidemiology Unit and is a supplement to the submission of surplus blood samples from laboratories to PHE.

en: Serology can provide important information about background population immunity, and sentinel networks can provide a mechanism for systematic data collection and linkage to medical records and health outcomes.
zh: 血清学可以提供有关背景人群免疫力的重要信息，并且预警网络可以提供一种系统的数据收集机制以及与病历和健康结局的联系。
pert_zh: 血清学可以提供有关背景人群免疫力的重要信息，并且预警网络可以提供与病历和健康结局的联系。
bt_pert_zh: Serology can provide important information about background population immunity, and early warning networks can provide links to medical records and health outcomes.

en: The serology pilot has demonstrated the ability of the network to collect serology samples in adults.
zh: 血清学试点工作已经证明了该网络采集成年人血清学样本的能力。
pert_zh: 血清学试点已经证明了该网络采集成年人血清学样本的能力。
bt_pert_zh: The serology pilot has demonstrated the network’s ability to collect serology samples from adults.

en: With the COVID-19 outbreak, PHE and RCGP RSC have adapted existing influenza surveillance to monitor the spread of COVID-19 in the community, and this protocol sets out the basis for that collaboration.
zh: 随着 COVID-19 的爆发，PHE 和 RCGP RSC 调整了现有的流感监测措施以便监测 COVID-19 的社区扩散，本方案为这种合作奠定了基础。
pert_zh: 随着 COVID-19 的爆发，PHE 调整了现有的流感监测措施以便监测 COVID-19 的社区扩散，本方案为这种合作奠定了基础。
bt_pert_zh: With the outbreak of COVID-19, PHE has adapted its existing influenza surveillance measures to monitor the community spread of COVID-19 and this protocol provides the basis for this collaboration.

en: The primary national strategy for COVID-19 infection is containment, with patients who are at high risk managed via the telephone help system NHS111 and the PHE health protection teams, but the RCGP RSC surveillance is entirely separate.
zh: 国家针对 COVID-19 感染的主要策略是控制，通过电话帮助系统 NHS111 和 PHE 健康保护团队管理高危患者，但 RCGP RSC 的监测是完全独立的。
pert_zh: 国家针对 COVID-19 感染的主要策略是控制，通过电话帮助系统 NHS111 和 PHE 健康保护团队管理高危患者，但 RCGP 的监测是完全独立的。
bt_pert_zh: The nation’s main strategy for COVID-19 infections is containment, with high-risk patients managed by the telephone help system NHS111 and PHE Health Protection Team, but the RCGP’s surveillance is completely independent.

en: The RCGP RSC, by extending its established work, will provide virological and serological surveillance to monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 infection in the community, and assess the effectiveness of the containment strategy.
zh: RCGP RSC 将通过扩展其既定工作提供病毒学和血清学监测，用于监控 COVID-19 社区感染的时间和地域分布以及评估控制策略的有效性。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC 通过扩展其既定工作提供病毒学和血清学监测，用于监控 COVID-19 社区感染时间和地域分布以及评估控制策略的有效性。
bt_pert_zh: The RCGP RSC provides virological and serological surveillance by expanding its established work to monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 community infections and to assess the effectiveness of control strategies.

en: We would not be working in isolation on this research.
zh: 我们不会孤身从事这项研究。
pert_zh: 我们不会从事这项研究。
bt_pert_zh: We will not engage in this research.

en: We will share the protocol with UK colleagues and the I-MOVE consortium who have recently obtained EU Horizon 2020 funding from the stream “Advancing knowledge for the clinical and public health response to the novel coronavirus epidemic”.
zh: 我们会将该方案与英国的同事以及 I-MOVE 联盟共享，后者最近因为“提高对新型冠状病毒疫情的临床和公共卫生响应的知识”获得了欧盟“地平线 2020”项目的资助。
pert_zh: 我们会将该方案与英国的同事以及 I-MOVE 联盟共享，后者最近因为“提高对新型冠状病毒疫情的临床和公共卫生响应的知识”获得了欧盟资助。
bt_pert_zh: We will be sharing this protocol with colleagues in the UK and with the I-MOVE consortium, which recently received EU funding for ‘improving knowledge on clinical and public health responses to the novel coronavirus outbreak’.

en: It is anticipated that great efficiencies in project management will result through this collaboration than that obtained from countries acting alone.
zh: 与单独采取行动的国家相比，预计通过这种合作将会获得更高的项目管理效率。
pert_zh: 与单独采取行动的国家相比，预计通过合作将会获得更高的项目管理效率。
bt_pert_zh: It is expected that greater project management efficiencies will be achieved through collaboration compared to countries acting alone.

en: The aim of this study is to identify whether there is undetected community transmission of COVID-19, estimate population susceptibility, and monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 infection in the community.
zh: 这项研究旨在确定是否存在未检测到的 COVID-19 社区传播，估计人群的易感性，并监测社会中 COVID-19 感染的时间和地域分布。
pert_zh: 这项研究旨在确定是否存在未检测到的 COVID-19 社区传播，估计人群的易感性，监测社会中 COVID-19 感染的时间和地域分布。
bt_pert_zh: This study aims to determine whether there is undetected community transmission of COVID-19, estimate the susceptibility of the population, and monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 infections in society.

en: The objectives of this study are as follows:
zh: 这项研究的目的如下：
pert_zh: 这项研究目的如下：
bt_pert_zh: The objectives of this study are as follows:

en: To monitor the burden of suspected COVID-19 activity in the community through primary care surveillance and clinical coding of possible COVID-19 cases referred into the containment pathway
zh: 通过基层医疗监测以及转诊至控制通道的可能 COVID-19 病例的临床编码来监测社区中疑似 COVID-19 活动的负担
pert_zh: 通过基层医疗监测以及转诊至控制通道的可能 COVID-19 病例的临床编码监测社区中疑似 COVID-19 活动的负担
bt_pert_zh: Monitor the burden of suspected COVID-19 activity in the community through primary care surveillance and clinical coding of possible COVID-19 cases referred to control channels

en: To provide virological evidence on the presence and extent of undetected community transmission of COVID-19 and monitor positivity rates among individuals presenting ILI or acute respiratory tract infections to primary care
zh: 提供关于未检测到的 COVID-19 社区传播的存在和程度的病毒学证据，并监测前往基层医疗机构就诊的 ILI 或急性呼吸道感染患者中的阳性率
pert_zh: 提供关于未检测到的 COVID-19 社区传播的存在和程度的病毒学证据，并监测前往基层医疗机构就诊的 ILI 或急性呼吸道感染患者中的阳性率。
bt_pert_zh: Provide virological evidence on the presence and extent of undetected community transmission of COVID-19 and monitor the positivity rate among patients with ILI or acute respiratory infection visiting primary care settings.

en: To estimate baseline susceptibility to COVID-19 in the community and estimate both symptomatic and asymptomatic exposure rates in the population through seroprevalence monitoring
zh: 估计社区人群对 COVID-19 的基线易感性，并通过血清阳性率监测估计人群的有症状和无症状暴露率
pert_zh: 估计社区人群对 COVID-19 的基线易感性，并血清阳性率监测估计人群的有症状和无症状暴露率
bt_pert_zh: Estimate baseline susceptibility of the community population to COVID-19 and use seroprevalence monitoring to estimate symptomatic and asymptomatic exposure rates in the population

en: To pilot implementation of a scheme for collection of convalescent sera with antibody profiles among recovered cases of COVID-19 discharged to the community
zh: 试行一项计划，在出院的已康复 COVID-19 病例中采集具有抗体谱的康复期血清
pert_zh: 试行一项计划，在出院的 COVID-19 病例中采集具有抗体谱的康复期血清
bt_pert_zh: Piloting a program to collect convalescent sera with antibody profiles from discharged COVID-19 cases

en: We intend to capture the following.
zh: 我们打算采集以下信息。
pert_zh: 我们打算采集信息。
bt_pert_zh: We intend to collect information.

en: Clinical workload related to reports of COVID-19 using the codes created to flag cases, those being assessed and where the infection is located are excluded (Figures 2-​-44)
zh: 使用创建用于标记病例的编码进行 COVID-19 报告相关的临床工作量，正在接受评估的病例以及已经确定感染的地点排除在外（图 2-​-44）
pert_zh: 使用创建用于标记病例的编码进行 COVID-19 相关的临床工作量，正在接受评估的病例以及已经确定感染的地点排除在外。
bt_pert_zh: COVID-19 related clinical workload was performed using codes created to label cases, excluding cases that were under evaluation and where the site of infection had been identified.

en: Foreign countries visited in the last 28 days
zh: 最近 28 天内访问过的其他国家
pert_zh: 最近访问过的其他国家
bt_pert_zh: Other countries recently visited

en: Existing codes that may have utility (Tables 1-​-3).3).
zh: 可能具有实用性的已有编码（表 1--3).3）。
pert_zh: 可能具有实用性的编码（表 1--3).3）。
bt_pert_zh: Coding that may be of practical use (Table 1--3).3).

en: Many GPs and primary care teams may not realize that important relevant data can be coded.
zh: 许多 GP 和基层医疗团队可能没有意识到可以对重要的相关数据进行编码。
pert_zh: 许多 GP 和基层医疗团队可能没有意识到对重要的相关数据进行编码。
bt_pert_zh: Many GPs and primary care teams may not be aware of coding important relevant data.

en: There is also the potential during any pandemic to monitor the effectiveness of any transmission control measures.
zh: 在任何疫情期间都有可能监测任何传播控制措施的有效性。
pert_zh: 在任何疫情期间有可能监测任何传播控制措施的有效性。
bt_pert_zh: During any outbreak it is possible to monitor the effectiveness of any transmission control measures.

en: Reliable coding of letters and test results that will show an infection has become either confirmed or excluded
zh: 可以显示感染已确诊或被排除的可靠字母编码和检测结果
pert_zh: 可以显示感染已确诊或被排除的字母编码和检测结果。
bt_pert_zh: It can show the letter code and test results whether the infection has been confirmed or ruled out.

en: The methods will follow the approach used in the current influenza surveillance system and recent serology study, and includes five components: (1) primary care clinical surveillance; (2) virological surveillance; (3) population serological surveillance; (4) convalescent sera in cases; and (5) data curation.
zh: 这些方法将遵循在当前流感监测系统和近期血清学研究中使用的方法，包括五个组成部分：(1) 基层医疗临床监测；(2) 病毒学监测；(3) 人群血清学监测；(4) 病例的康复期血清；以及 (5) 数据管护。
pert_zh: 这些方法将遵循在当前流感监测系统和近期血清学研究中使用的方法，包括五个组成部分：(1) 基层医疗临床监测；(2) 人群血清学监测；(3) 病例的康复期血清；以及 (5) 数据管护。
bt_pert_zh: These approaches will follow those used in current influenza surveillance systems and recent serological studies and include five components: (1) primary care clinical surveillance; (2) population serological surveillance; (3) convalescent sera from cases; and (5) data curation.

en: The NHS uses the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms (SNOMED CT) system of coding, which is normally only updated twice annually.
zh: NHS 使用临床医学系统术语 (SNOMED CT) 编码系统，通常每年仅更新两次。
pert_zh: NHS 使用临床医学系统术语 (SNOMED CT) 编码系统，通常每年更新两次。
bt_pert_zh: The NHS uses the Systematic Terminology for Clinical Medicine (SNOMED CT) coding system, which is usually updated twice a year.

en: There was added complexity as some computerized medical record (CMR) suppliers use the Read coding systems (Read clinical terms version 3 – CTv3), which is no longer updated.
zh: 由于某些计算机化病历 (CMR) 供应商使用已经不再更新的读取编码系统 (Read clinical terms version 3 – CTv3)，因此增加了复杂性。
pert_zh: 由于某些计算机化病历 (CMR) 供应商使用已经不再更新的读取编码系统 (Read clinical terms version 3)，因此增加了复杂性。
bt_pert_zh: There is an added complexity as some computerized medical record (CMR) vendors use a read coding system (Read clinical terms version 3) that is no longer updated.

en: Additionally, there were no clinical codes to record COVID-19 in early February 2020.
zh: 此外，在 2020 年 2 月上旬还没有用于记录 COVID-19 的临床编码。
pert_zh: 此外，在 2020 年上旬还没有用于记录 COVID-19 的临床编码。
bt_pert_zh: Additionally, in early 2020 there were no clinical codes for documenting COVID-19.

en: Therefore, the two main GP system suppliers added the five terms shown in Table 4 as system-wide local codes.
zh: 因此，两个主要 GP 系统供应商添加了表 4 所示的五个术语，作为系统范围内的本地编码。
pert_zh: 因此，两个主要 GP 系统供应商添加了表 4 所示的五个术语，作为系统范围内的编码。
bt_pert_zh: Therefore, the two major GP system vendors added the five terms shown in Table 4 as system-wide codes.

en: A UK emergency release of SNOMED CT concepts for COVID-19 was also subsequently made available across all CMR systems (Table 4).
zh: 随后，也在所有 CMR 系统中提供了英国针对 COVID-19 的 SNOMED CT 概念的紧急版本（表 4）。
pert_zh: 随后，也提供了英国针对 COVID-19 的 SNOMED CT 概念的紧急版本（表 4）。
bt_pert_zh: Subsequently, an emergency version of the UK SNOMED CT concept for COVID-19 was also provided ( Table 4 ).

en: The intention is that these will eventually be mapped to the new SNOMED CT concepts as they become available, allowing recording of relevant data (Multimedia Appendix 1).
zh: 目的是在它们可用时最终映射到新的 SNOMED CT 概念，从而允许记录相关数据（多媒体附录 1）。
pert_zh: 目的是在它们可用时最终映射到新的 SNOMED CT 概念，从而允许记录相关数据。
bt_pert_zh: The intention is to eventually map to the new SNOMED CT concepts as they become available, thus allowing the recording of relevant data.

en: The key requirements for this release were the ability to code (Table 4) a case of COVID-19, exposure to risk of infection (travel to an area where there may be a higher risk), contact with anyone infected with COVID-19, a report that a person had been tested for COVID-19, and that the disease had been excluded (likely a negative test).
zh: 此版本的关键要求包括：编码（表 4）COVID-19 病例的能力，暴露于感染的风险（到可能存在较高风险区域的旅行史），与 COVID-19 感染者的接触，COVID-19 检测报告，以及疾病已被排除（例如阴性检测结果）。
pert_zh: 此版本的关键要求包括：编码（表 4）COVID-19 病例的能力，暴露于感染的风险（到可能存在较高风险区域的旅行史），COVID-19 检测报告，以及疾病已被排除（例如阴性检测结果）。
bt_pert_zh: Key requirements for this version include the ability to code ( Table 4 ) COVID-19 cases, exposure to infection (travel history to areas where there may be a higher risk), COVID-19 test reports, and that the disease has been ruled out (e.g., negative test results).

en: In addition, practices are now able to code any foreign travel undertaken, including the ability to record visits to multiple countries (implemented February 8, 2020).
zh: 此外，诊所现在能够对任何国外旅行史进行编码，包括记录多个国家旅行史的能力（自 2020 年 2 月 8 日起实施）。
pert_zh: 此外，诊所现在能够对任何国外旅行史进行编码。
bt_pert_zh: Additionally, clinics are now able to code any foreign travel history.

en: Figures 2-​-44 show the EMIS web implementation.
zh: 图 2-44 显示了 EMIS Web 实施方案。
pert_zh: 图 2-44 显示了 EMIS 实施方案。
bt_pert_zh: Figure 2-44 shows an EMIS implementation plan.

en: Currently, virology samples for influenza surveillance are accompanied by a standard request form.
zh: 目前，用于流感监测的病毒学样本附有标准申请单。
pert_zh: 目前，用于流感监测的样本附有标准申请单。
bt_pert_zh: Currently, samples for influenza surveillance are accompanied by a standard request form.

en: For COVID-19, we will create a new request form that will record:
zh: 对于 COVID-19，我们将创建一个新的申请单，其中将记录：
pert_zh: 对于 COVID-19，创建一个新的申请单，将记录：
bt_pert_zh: For COVID-19, create a new ticket that will record:

en: Date of onset of symptoms
zh: 症状发作日期
pert_zh: 症状日期
bt_pert_zh: Symptom date

en: Diagnosis of any of the following:
zh: 以下任何一项诊断：
pert_zh: 以下一项诊断：
bt_pert_zh: One of the following diagnoses:

zh: 五岁以下儿童的急性支气管炎/细支气管炎
pert_zh: 五岁以下急性支气管炎/细支气管炎
bt_pert_zh: Acute bronchitis/bronchiolitis in children under five years of age

zh: 下呼吸道感染 (LRTI)
pert_zh: 呼吸道感染 (LRTI)
bt_pert_zh: Respiratory tract infection (LRTI)

en: History of fever (Y/N); measured (Y/N); if yes, level
zh: 发热史（是/否）；已测量（是/否）; 如果是，则记录体温
pert_zh: 发热史（是/否）; 已测量（是/否）; 如果是，则记录体温
bt_pert_zh: History of fever (yes/no); measured (yes/no); if yes, recorded temperature
