en: The global Solidarity and European Discovery trials of hospitalized people with severe COVID-19 infection apply adaptive design to rapidly alter trial parameters as results from the four experimental therapeutic strategies emerge.
zh: 针对 COVID-19 重症住院患者的全球 Solidarity 和欧洲 Discovery 试验便采用了适应性设计，根据四个实验治疗策略的结果，快速调整试验参数。
pert_zh: 针对 COVID-19 重症住院患者的全球 Solidarity 和欧洲 Discovery 试验便采用了适应性设计，快速调整试验参数。
bt_pert_zh: The global Solidarity and European Discovery trials in patients hospitalized with severe COVID-19 used adaptive designs to rapidly adjust trial parameters.

en: Adaptive designs within ongoing Phase II-III clinical trials on candidate therapeutics may shorten trial durations and use fewer subjects, possibly expediting decisions for early termination or success, and coordinating design changes for a specific trial across its international locations.
zh: 对于正在进行的 II-III 期候选疗法临床实验，适应性设计可缩短试验持续时间，减少受试者数量，这样有望提前做出终止或成功决定，并协调对全球各地的特定试验进行设计变更。
pert_zh: 对于正在进行的 II-III 期候选疗法临床实验，适应性设计可缩短试验持续时间，减少受试者数量，有望提前做出终止或成功决定，并协调对全球各地的特定试验进行设计变更。
bt_pert_zh: For ongoing Phase II-III clinical trials of candidate therapeutics, adaptive designs can shorten trial duration, reduce the number of subjects, have the potential to make earlier termination or success decisions, and coordinate design changes for specific trials around the world.

en: Most novel drug candidates (NCEs) fail during drug development, either because they have unacceptable toxicity or because they simply do not prove efficacy on the targeted disease, as shown in Phase II-III clinical trials.
zh: 大部分新候选药物 (NCE) 在开发过程中均会遭遇失败，有的因为具有不可接受的毒性，有的因为完全无法证明对目标疾病有疗效，这些情况在 II-III 期临床试验中均会显现出来。
pert_zh: 大部分新候选药物 (NCE) 在开发过程中均会遭遇失败，有的因为具有不可接受的毒性，有的因为完全无法证明对目标疾病有疗效，在 II-III 期临床试验中均会显现出来。
bt_pert_zh: Most new candidate drugs (NCEs) fail during development, either because of unacceptable toxicity or because of a complete failure to demonstrate efficacy against the target disease, as evidenced in Phase II-III clinical trials.

en: The high failure rates associated with pharmaceutical development are referred to as an "attrition rate", requiring decisions during the early stages of drug development to "kill" projects early to avoid costly failures.
zh: 药物开发的高失败率也称“损耗率”，要求在药物开发早期做出决定，尽早“终止”项目，以避免失败的代价过高。
pert_zh: 药物开发的高失败率也称“损耗率”，要求在药物开发早期做出决定，"终止"项目，以避免失败的代价过高。
bt_pert_zh: The high failure rate in drug development, also known as the “attrition rate,” requires that decisions be made early in drug development to “kill” the project to avoid costly failures.

en: One 2010 study assessed both capitalized and out-of-pocket costs for bringing a single new drug to market as about US$1.8 billion and $870 million, respectively.
zh: 2010 年的一项研究估计，将一种新药推向市场的资本化成本和自付费用分别约为 18 亿美元和 8.7 亿美元。
pert_zh: 2010 年的一项研究估计，将一种新药推向市场的资本化成本分别约为 18 亿美元和 8.7 亿美元。
bt_pert_zh: A 2010 study estimated the capitalized costs of bringing a new drug to market to be approximately $1.8 billion and $870 million, respectively.

en: A median cost estimate of 2015-16 trials for development of 10 anti-cancer drugs was $648 million.
zh: 2015-16 年 10 种抗癌药物的研发试验成本中位数为 6.48 亿美元。
pert_zh: 2015-16 年 10 种抗癌药物的研发试验成本中位数为 6.48 美元。
bt_pert_zh: The median cost of R&D trials for 10 cancer drugs was $6.48 in 2015-16.

en: In a 2016 review of 106 drug candidates assessed through clinical trials, the total capital expenditure for a manufacturer having a drug approved through successful Phase III trials was $2.6 billion (in 2013 dollars), an amount increasing at an annual rate of 8.5%.
zh: 在 2016 年对通过临床试验评估的 106 种候选药物的审查中，一家制造商成功通过 III 期试验获得批准的药物的总资本支出为 26 亿美元（以 2013 年的美元价值计），每年以 8.5% 的速度增长。
pert_zh: 在 2016 年对通过临床试验评估的 106 种候选药物的审查中，一家制造商成功通过 III 期试验获得批准的药物的总资本支出为 26 亿美元（以 2013 年的美元价值计），以 8.5% 的速度增长。
bt_pert_zh: In a 2016 review of 106 drug candidates evaluated through clinical trials, total capital expenditures for a drug that successfully made it through Phase III trials to approval by one manufacturer were $2.6 billion (in 2013 dollars), an increase of 8.5%.

en: Seven trials were evaluating repurposed drugs already approved to treat malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine phosphate.
zh: 七项试验正在评估已批准用于治疗疟疾的再利用药物，包括四项关于羟氯喹或磷酸氯喹的研究。
pert_zh: 七项试验正在评估已批准用于治疗疟疾的再利用药物，包括四项研究。
bt_pert_zh: Seven trials are evaluating repurposed drugs already approved for treating malaria, including four studies.

en: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with 9 Phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
zh: 中国大部分药物研究均涉及再利用其他抗病毒药物，预计到 4 月底，将有多个国家基于报告结果针对瑞德西韦开展 9 项 III 期试验。
pert_zh: 中国大部分药物研究均涉及再利用其他抗病毒药物，将有多个国家基于报告结果针对瑞德西韦开展 9 项 III 期试验。
bt_pert_zh: Most of China's drug research involves repurposing other antiviral drugs, and several countries will conduct 9 Phase III trials for remdesivir based on the reported results.

en: Led by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation with partners investing US$125 million and coordinating with the World Health Organization, the COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator began in March, facilitating drug development researchers to rapidly identify, assess, develop, and scale up potential treatments.
zh: 比尔及梅琳达·盖茨基金会牵头与多家合作伙伴共同投资了 1.25 亿美元，并与世界卫生组织协调于 3 月启动“COVID-19 治疗加速器”，协助药物开发研究人员快速识别、评估、开发和扩大潜在治疗方案。
pert_zh: 比尔及梅琳达·盖茨基金会牵头与多家合作伙伴共同投资了 1.25 亿美元，并于 3 月启动“COVID-19 治疗加速器”，协助药物开发研究人员快速识别、评估、开发和扩大潜在治疗方案。
bt_pert_zh: The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation led a $125 million investment with multiple partners to launch the COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator in March to assist drug development researchers in quickly identifying, evaluating, developing and expanding potential treatment options.

en: The COVID-19 Clinical Research Coalition formed to coordinate and expedite results from international clinical trials on the most promising post-infection treatments.
zh: 此外还成立了 COVID-19 临床研究联盟，以协调和加快获得最有望用于感染后治疗的国际临床试验结果。
pert_zh: 此外还成立了 COVID-19 临床研究联盟，以协调和加快获得最有望用于感染后治疗的国际临床试验。
bt_pert_zh: The COVID-19 Clinical Research Alliance has also been established to coordinate and accelerate access to the most promising international clinical trials for post-infection treatments.

en: In early 2020, numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections were being repurposed or developed in new clinical research efforts to alleviate the illness of COVID-19.
zh: 2020 年初，很多既往用于治疗其他传染病的抗病毒化合物在新的临床研究中被重新设计或开发，希望能用于缓解 COVID-19 症状。
pert_zh: 2020 年初，很多既往用于治疗其他传染病的抗病毒化合物在新的临床研究中被重新设计或开发，用于缓解 COVID-19 症状。
bt_pert_zh: In early 2020, many antiviral compounds previously used to treat other infectious diseases were redesigned or developed in new clinical studies for alleviating COVID-19 symptoms.

en: For an already-approved drug (such as hydroxychloroquine for malaria), Phase III-IV trials determine in hundreds to thousands of COVID-19-infected people the possible extended use of an already-approved drug for treating COVID-19 infection.
zh: 对于已经获批的药物（如用于治疗疟疾的羟氯喹），在针对数百至数千名 COVID-19 感染者的 III-IV 期试验中确定，可以延续使用已获批的药物来治疗 COVID-19 感染。
pert_zh: 对于已经获批的药物在针对数百至数千名 COVID-19 感染者的 III-IV 期试验中确定，可以延续使用已获批的药物来治疗 COVID-19 感染。
bt_pert_zh: For approved drugs, continued use of approved drugs to treat COVID-19 infection may be warranted as determined in Phase III-IV trials of hundreds to thousands of people infected with COVID-19.

en: As of early April 2020, 103 candidate therapeutics were in preclinical or a stage of Phase I-IV development, with trial results for 29 drug candidates expected during April.
zh: 截至 2020 年 4 月初，共有 103 种候选药物处于临床前或 I-IV 期研发阶段，预计 4 月份将获得 29 种候选药物的试验结果。
pert_zh: 截至 2020 年 4 月初，共有 103 种候选药物处于临床前或 I-IV 期研发阶段，预计将获得 29 种候选药物的试验结果。
bt_pert_zh: As of early April 2020, there are 103 drug candidates in preclinical or Phase I-IV development, with trial results expected for 29 candidates.

en: In March, the World Health Organization (WHO) launched the coordinated "Solidarity trial" in 10 countries to rapidly assess in thousands of COVID-19 infected people the potential efficacy of existing antiviral and anti-inflammatory agents not yet evaluated specifically for COVID-19 illness.
zh: 今年 3 月，世界卫生组织 (WTO) 在 10 个国家启动了“Solidarity 试验”，促进相互协调，以便对数千名 COVID-19 感染者进行快速评估，了解尚未专门针对 COVID-19 接受评估的现有抗病毒和消炎药的潜在功效。
pert_zh: 今年 3 月，世界卫生组织 (WTO) 在 10 个国家启动了“Solidarity 试验”，促进相互协调，以便对数千名 COVID-19 感染者进行快速评估，了解尚未专门针对 COVID-19 接受评估的抗病毒和消炎药的潜在功效。
bt_pert_zh: In March, the World Health Organization (WHO) launched the Solidarity Trial in 10 countries to facilitate coordination to rapidly evaluate in thousands of people infected with COVID-19 the potential efficacy of antiviral and anti-inflammatory drugs that have not been specifically evaluated for COVID-19.

en: Do any of the drugs reduce mortality?
zh: 这些药物能否降低死亡率？
pert_zh: 这些药物能否降低？
bt_pert_zh: Can these drugs reduce?

en: Do any of the drugs reduce the time a patient is hospitalized?
zh: 这些药物能否缩短患者住院时间？
pert_zh: 这些药物能否缩短患者时间？
bt_pert_zh: Can these drugs shorten the time for patients?

en: Do the treatments affect the need for people with COVID-19-induced pneumonia to be ventilated or maintained in intensive care?
zh: 这些治疗能否减少 COVID-19 肺炎患者使用呼吸机或进入重症监护室维持生命的需求？
pert_zh: 这些治疗能否减少 COVID-19 肺炎患者使用呼吸机的需求？
bt_pert_zh: Could these treatments reduce the need for ventilators in patients with COVID-19 pneumonia?

en: Could such drugs be used to minimize the illness of COVID-19 infection in healthcare staff and people at high risk of developing severe illness?Enrolling people with COVID-19 infection is simplified by using data entries, including informed consent, on a WHO website.
zh: 这种药物能否最大限度减少医务人员感染 COVID-19 的几率并减少高风险人群发展成重症患者的情况？在 WHO 网站上只需输入包括知情同意在内的数据，即可登记 COVID-19 感染者。
pert_zh: 这种药物能否最大限度减少医务人员感染 COVID-19 的几率并减少高风险人群发展成重症患者的情况？在 WHO 网站上包括知情同意在内的数据，即可登记 COVID-19 感染者。
bt_pert_zh: Can this drug minimize the chances of health workers becoming infected with COVID-19 and reduce the number of high-risk groups developing severe illness? People infected with COVID-19 can be registered on the WHO website with data including informed consent.

en: After the trial staff determines the drugs available at the hospital, the WHO website randomizes the hospitalized subject to one of the trial drugs or to the hospital standard of care for treating COVID-19.
zh: 试验人员确定医院可提供的药物后，WHO 网站将为住院受试者随机分配一种试验药物或安排其接受针对 COVID-19 的护理标准。
pert_zh: 试验人员确定医院可提供的药物后，将为住院受试者随机分配一种试验药物或安排其接受针对 COVID-19 的护理标准。
bt_pert_zh: Once trial researchers determine which drugs are available at the hospital, hospitalized participants will be randomly assigned to an investigational drug or to receive standard of care for COVID-19.

en: The trial physician records and submits follow-up information about the subject status and treatment, completing data input via the WHO Solidarity website.
zh: 试验医生会记录并提交有关受试者状态和治疗情况的随访信息，通过 WHO Solidarity 网站完成数据输入。
pert_zh: 试验医生会提交有关受试者治疗情况的随访信息，通过 WHO Solidarity 网站完成数据输入。
bt_pert_zh: Trial physicians will submit follow-up information on the subjects' treatment status and complete data entry through the WHO Solidarity website.

en: A global safety monitoring board of WHO physicians examine interim results to assist decisions on safety and effectiveness of the trial drugs, and alter the trial design or recommend an effective therapy.
zh: 由 WHO 医师组成的全球安全监测委员会负责审查中期结果，以协助决定试验药物的安全性和有效性，调整试验设计或推荐有效的治疗方法。
pert_zh: 由 WHO 医师组成的全球安全监测委员会负责审查结果，以协助决定试验药物的安全性和有效性，调整试验设计或推荐有效的治疗方法。
bt_pert_zh: A Global Safety Monitoring Committee, composed of WHO physicians, reviews the results to help decide on the safety and effectiveness of the trial drugs, adjust the trial design or recommend effective treatments.

en: A similar web-based study to Solidarity, called "Discovery", was initiated in March across seven countries by INSERM (Paris, France).During March, funding for the Solidarity trial reached US$108 million from 203,000 individuals, organizations and governments, with 45 countries involved in financing or trial management.
zh: 今年 3 月，INSERM（法国巴黎）在七个国家发起了一项类似于“Solidarity”的网络调查，命名为“Discovery”。3 月，Solidarity 试验共获得来自 203,000 个组织、个人和政府的 1.08 亿美元捐款，共有 45 个国家参与了捐款或试验管理。
pert_zh: 今年 3 月，INSERM（法国巴黎）在七个国家发起了一项类似于“Solidarity”的网络调查，命名为“Discovery”。Solidarity 试验共获得来自 203,000 个组织、个人和政府的 1.08 亿美元捐款，共有 45 个国家参与了捐款或试验管理。
bt_pert_zh: In March this year, INSERM (Paris, France) launched a web-based investigation similar to Solidarity in seven countries, named Discovery. The Solidarity trial received $108 million in donations from 203,000 organizations, individuals, and governments, with 45 countries participating in donations or trial management.

en: Numerous candidate drugs under study as "supportive" treatments to relieve discomfort during illness, such as NSAIDs or bronchodilators, are not included in the table below.
zh: 很多候选药物，如非甾体抗炎药或支气管扩张剂，也作为缓解疾病不适的“支持性”治疗药物纳入到研究当中，不包含在下表中。
pert_zh: 很多候选药物，如非甾体抗炎药或支气管扩张剂，作为缓解疾病不适的“支持性”治疗药物纳入到研究当中，不包含在下表中。
bt_pert_zh: Many candidate drugs, such as NSAIDs or bronchodilators, are being studied as “supportive” therapies to relieve disease discomfort and are not included in the table below.

en: Others in early-stage Phase II trials or numerous treatment candidates in Phase I trials, are also excluded.
zh: 早期 II 期试验的其他药物或 I 期试验中的大量候选药物也不在列。
pert_zh: 早期 II 试验的其他药物或 I 期试验中的大量候选药物也不在列。
bt_pert_zh: Other drugs in early Phase II trials or a large number of drug candidates in Phase I trials are also not included.

en: Drug candidates in Phase I-II trials have a low rate of success (under 12%) to pass through all trial phases to gain eventual approval.
zh: I-II 期试验中的候选药物通过所有试验阶段并获得最终批准的成功率很低（不到 12%）。
pert_zh: I-II 期试验中的候选药物通过所有试验阶段并获得最终成功率很低（不到 12%）。
bt_pert_zh: The rate at which drug candidates in Phase I-II trials make it through all trial stages and ultimately succeed is low (less than 12%).

en: Hydroxychloroquine is more commonly available than chloroquine in the United States.
zh: 在美国，羟氯喹比氯喹更常见。
pert_zh: 在美国，羟氯喹更常见。
bt_pert_zh: In the United States, hydroxychloroquine is more commonly used.

en: Although several countries use chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine for treatment of persons hospitalized with COVID-19, as of March 2020 the drug has not been formally approved through clinical trials in the United States.
zh: 尽管一些国家会使用氯喹或羟氯喹来治疗 COVID-19 患者，但截至 2020 年 3 月，这两种药尚未获得美国临床试验的正式批准。
pert_zh: 尽管一些国家会使用氯喹或羟氯喹来治疗 COVID-19 患者，但截至 2020 年 3 月，这两种药未获得美国临床试验的正式批准。
bt_pert_zh: Although some countries are using chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine to treat COVID-19 patients, as of March 2020, neither drug has been formally approved for clinical trials in the United States.

en: Chloroquine has been recommended by Chinese, South Korean and Italian health authorities for the treatment of COVID-19, although these agencies and the US CDC noted contraindications for people with heart disease or diabetes.
zh: 中国、韩国和意大利卫生机构已推荐使用氯喹来治疗 COVID-19 患者，不过这些机构和美国疾病预防与控制中心均指出心脏病或糖尿病患者不宜使用。
pert_zh: 中国、韩国和意大利卫生机构已推荐使用氯喹来治疗 COVID-19 患者，不过这些机构和美国疾病预防与控制中心均指。
bt_pert_zh: Chinese, South Korean and Italian health agencies have recommended the use of chloroquine to treat COVID-19 patients, though both those agencies and the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention say.

en: Both drugs have extensive interactions with prescription drugs, affecting the therapeutic dose and disease mitigation.
zh: 这两种药与大量处方药会发生相互作用，从而影响治疗剂量和疾病缓解效果。
pert_zh: 这两种药与处方药会发生相互作用，从而影响治疗剂量和疾病缓解效果。
bt_pert_zh: Both drugs can interact with prescription medications, affecting treatment dosage and disease-modifying effects.

en: Some people have allergic reactions to these drugs.On 12 April, a preliminary clinical trial conducted at a hospital in Brazil was stopped when several people given high doses of chloroquine for COVID-19 infection developed irregular heart rates, causing 11 deaths.
zh: 有些人对这些药物有过敏反应。4 月 12 日，巴西一家医院进行的一项初步临床试验被迫停止，因为多人因过量服用氯喹治疗 COVID-19 而导致心律不齐，最终造成 11 人死亡。
pert_zh: 有些人对这些药物有过敏反应。4 月 12 日，巴西一家医院进行的一项初步临床试验被迫停止，因为多人因过量服用氯喹治疗 COVID-19 而导致心律不齐。
bt_pert_zh: Some people have allergic reactions to the drugs. On April 12, a preliminary clinical trial at a Brazilian hospital was halted after several people developed irregular heartbeats from overdoses of chloroquine to treat COVID-19.

en: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show that favipiravir was "clearly effective".
zh: 中国在武汉和深圳的临床试验表明，法匹拉韦“效果明显”。
pert_zh: 中国在武汉的临床试验表明，法匹拉韦“效果明显”。
bt_pert_zh: China's clinical trials in Wuhan showed that favipiravir was "significantly effective."

en: Of 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
zh: 在深圳 35 位患者中，平均服药 4 天可检测为阴性，而在 45 名未服用该药的患者中，患病 11 天后才会检测为阴性。
pert_zh: 在深圳 35 位患者中，平均服药 4 天可检测为阴性，而在 45 名未服用该药的患者中，检测为阴性。
bt_pert_zh: Among the 35 patients in Shenzhen, those who took the drug tested negative after an average of four days, while among the 45 patients who did not take the drug, the test was negative.

en: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
zh: 在武汉对 240 名肺炎患者进行的研究中，一半服用了法匹拉韦，一半服用了盐酸阿比朵尔。
pert_zh: 在武汉对 240 名肺炎患者进行的研究中，一半服用了法匹拉韦。
bt_pert_zh: In the Wuhan study of 240 pneumonia patients, half were given favipiravir.

en: The term "preclinical research" is defined by laboratory studies in vitro and in vivo, indicating a beginning stage for development of a vaccine, antiviral or monoclonal antibody therapy, such as experiments to determine effective doses and toxicity, before a candidate compound is advanced for safety and efficacy evaluation in humans.
zh: “临床前研究”一词通过体外和体内实验室研究定义，代表疫苗、抗病毒或单克隆抗体疗法的起始阶段，例如通过实验确定有效剂量和毒性，然后才能在人体中开展候选化合物的安全性和功效评估。
pert_zh: “临床前研究”一词定义代表疫苗、抗病毒或单克隆抗体疗法的起始阶段，例如通过实验确定有效剂量和毒性，然后才能在人体中开展候选化合物的安全性和功效评估。
bt_pert_zh: The term “preclinical studies” is defined to represent the initial stages of a vaccine, antiviral or monoclonal antibody therapy, such as determining effective doses and toxicity through experiments before the candidate compound’s safety and efficacy can be evaluated in humans.

en: Some antibiotics may be repurposed as COVID-19 treatments:
zh: 一些抗生素可能也可用于治疗 COVID-19：
pert_zh: 一些抗生素可能可用于治疗 COVID-19：
bt_pert_zh: Some antibiotics may be useful in treating COVID-19:

en: In March 2020, the main protease of the SARS-CoV-2 virus was identified as a target for post-infection drugs.
zh: 2020 年 3 月，确定将 SARS-CoV-2 病毒的主要蛋白酶作为感染后的药物攻击目标。
pert_zh: 2020 年 3 月，将 SARS-CoV-2 病毒的主要蛋白酶作为感染后的药物攻击目标。
bt_pert_zh: In March 2020, the main protease of the SARS-CoV-2 virus was targeted by drugs after infection.

en: This enzyme is essential to the host cell to reproduce the ribonucleic acid of the virus.
zh: 这种酶是宿主细胞复制病毒核糖核酸的必要条件。
pert_zh: 这种酶是宿主细胞复制的必要条件。
bt_pert_zh: This enzyme is essential for host cell replication.

en: To find the enzyme, scientists used the genome published by Chinese researchers in January 2020 to isolate the main protease.
zh: 为找到这种酶，科学家们利用中国研究人员在 2020 年 1 月公布的基因组来分离该主要蛋白酶。
pert_zh: 为找到这种酶，科学家们利用中国研究人员在 2020 年 1 月公布的基因组来分离蛋白酶。
bt_pert_zh: To find the enzyme, the scientists used a genome published by Chinese researchers in January 2020 to isolate the protease.

en: As a potential combination therapy, they are used together in two Phase III arms of the 2020 global Solidarity project on COVID-19.
zh: 作为一种潜在联合疗法，在 2020 年针对 COVID-19 的全球 Solidarity 项目中，它们一同接受了两项 III 期试验。
pert_zh: 作为一种潜在联合疗法，在 2020 年针对 COVID-19 的全球 Solidarity 项目中，它们接受了两项 III 期试验。
bt_pert_zh: As a potential combination therapy, they were subjected to two Phase III trials in 2020 as part of the global Solidarity program against COVID-19.

en: A preliminary study in China of combined lopinavir and ritonavir found no effect in people hospitalized for COVID-19.
zh: 一项在中国进行的联合使用洛匹那韦与利托那韦的初步研究发现，它们对 COVID-19 住院患者没有效果。
pert_zh: 一项在中国进行的联合使用洛匹那韦与利托那韦的初步研究发现，对 COVID-19 住院患者没有效果。
bt_pert_zh: A preliminary study in China of a combination of lopinavir and ritonavir found no effect in hospitalized patients with COVID-19.

en: It is unclear yet whether conditions arising during pregnancy including diabetes, cardiac failure, hypercoagulability or hypertension might represent additional risk factors for pregnant people as they do for nonpregnant people.From the limited data available, vertical transmission during the third trimester probably does not occur, or only occurs very rarely.
zh: 目前尚不清楚作为非妊娠人群额外风险因素的妊娠期间出现的疾病（包括糖尿病、心力衰竭、血液高凝状态或高血压）是否是妊娠人群的额外危险因素。从现有的有限数据来看，在妊娠晚期可能不会发生垂直传播，或者发生率极低。
pert_zh: 目前尚不清楚作为非妊娠人群额外风险因素的妊娠期间出现的疾病（包括高血压）是否是妊娠人群的额外危险因素。从现有的有限数据来看，在妊娠晚期可能不会发生垂直传播，或者发生率极低。
bt_pert_zh: It is unclear whether conditions that occur during pregnancy (including hypertension) are additional risk factors in the nonpregnant population. From the limited data available, vertical transmission may not occur during late pregnancy or may occur at a very low rate.

en: There is no data yet on early pregnancy.
zh: 尚无关于妊娠早期的数据。
pert_zh: 尚无妊娠早期的数据。
bt_pert_zh: There are no data during early pregnancy.

en: Little evidence exists to permit any solid conclusions about the nature of COVID-19 infection in pregnancy.
zh: 几乎没有证据可以得出关于妊娠期间 COVID-19 感染性质的可靠结论。
pert_zh: 几乎没有证据可以得出妊娠期间 COVID-19 感染性质的可靠结论。
bt_pert_zh: There is little evidence to draw firm conclusions about the nature of COVID-19 infection during pregnancy.

en: A case series of 43 women from New York who tested positive for COVID-19 showed similar patterns to non-pregnant adults: 86% had mild disease, 9.3% had severe disease and 4.7% developed critical disease.
zh: 一项对 43 名 COVID-19 检测阳性的纽约女性病例系列研究的结果显示与非妊娠成年人的模式相似：86% 为轻型疾病，9.3% 为重型疾病，4.7% 为危重型疾病。
pert_zh: 一项对 43 名 COVID-19 检测阳性的纽约女性病例系列研究的结果显示与非妊娠成年人的模式相似：86% 为轻型疾病，9.3% 为重型疾病。
bt_pert_zh: Results from a case series of 43 New York women who tested positive for COVID-19 showed a similar pattern to nonpregnant adults: 86% had mild disease and 9.3% had severe disease.

en: Fetal distress was reported in two.
zh: 报告两例出现胎儿宫内窘迫。
pert_zh: 报告两例出现胎儿窘迫。
bt_pert_zh: Two cases of fetal distress were reported.

en: None of the women developed severe COVID-19 pneumonia or died.
zh: 未出现严重 COVID-19 肺炎或死亡病例。
pert_zh: 未出现 COVID-19 肺炎或死亡病例。
bt_pert_zh: There were no cases of COVID-19 pneumonia or deaths.

en: All of them had live birth pregnancies and no severe neonatal asphyxia was observed.
zh: 所有病例均为活产妊娠，未观察到严重新生儿窒息。
pert_zh: 所有病例活产妊娠，未观察到严重新生儿窒息。
bt_pert_zh: All cases were live births, and no severe neonatal asphyxia was observed.

en: The samples of breast milk, amniotic fluid, cord blood and neonatal throat swab were tested for SARS-CoV-2, and all results were negative.In another study on 15 pregnant women, majority of the patients presented with fever and cough, while laboratory tests yielded lymphocytopenia in 12 patients.
zh: 对母乳、羊水、脐带血和新生儿咽拭子样本进行了 SARS-CoV-2 检测，所有结果均为阴性。在另一项针对 15 名孕妇进行的研究中，大多数患者表现为发热和咳嗽，实验室检测显示 12 例患者出现淋巴细胞减少症。
pert_zh: 对母乳、羊水、脐带血和新生儿咽拭子样本进行了 SARS-CoV-2 检测，所有结果均为阴性。在另一项针对 15 名孕妇进行的研究中，大多数患者表现为发热和咳嗽，12 例患者出现淋巴细胞减少症。
bt_pert_zh: Breast milk, amniotic fluid, umbilical cord blood, and neonatal throat swab samples were tested for SARS-CoV-2, and all results were negative. In another study of 15 pregnant women, most patients presented with fever and cough, and 12 patients developed lymphocytopenia.

en: Computed tomography findings of these patients were consistent with previous reports of non-pregnant patients, consisting of ground-glass opacities at early stage.
zh: 这些患者的计算机断层扫描结果与先前非妊娠患者的报告一致，包括早期磨玻璃影。
pert_zh: 这些患者的计算机断层扫描结果与先前的报告一致，包括早期磨玻璃影。
bt_pert_zh: Computed tomography findings in these patients were consistent with previous reports, including early ground-glass opacities.

en: Follow-up images after delivery showed no progression of pneumonia.Media reports indicate that over 100 women with COVID-19 might have delivered, and in March 2020, no maternal deaths were reported.
zh: 分娩后的随访图像未显示肺炎进展。媒体报道表明，在 2020 年 3 月可能有 100 多名患有 COVID-19 的女性分娩，没有孕妇死亡的报告。
pert_zh: 分娩后的随访图像未显示肺炎进展。在 2020 年 3 月可能有 100 多名患有 COVID-19 的女性分娩，没有孕妇死亡的报告。
bt_pert_zh: Follow-up images after delivery did not show progression of pneumonia. More than 100 women with COVID-19 may have given birth in March 2020, with no reports of maternal deaths.

en: Their guidelines thus advise that any pregnant person admitted to hospital with a COVID-19 infection should receive at least 10 days of prophylactic low-molecular-weight heparin after being discharged from the hospital.
zh: 因此，孕妇指南建议入院时存在 COVID-19 感染的所有孕妇在出院后都应接受至少 10 天的预防性低分子肝素治疗。
pert_zh: 因此，孕妇指南建议入院时 COVID-19 感染的所有孕妇在出院后都应接受至少 10 天的预防性低分子肝素治疗。
bt_pert_zh: Therefore, guidelines for pregnant women recommend that all pregnant women with COVID-19 infection at the time of admission should receive prophylactic low-molecular-weight heparin for at least 10 days after discharge.

en: There are no data yet concerning the implications of COVID-19 infections for labour.
zh: 尚无有关 COVID-19 感染对分娩影响的数据。
pert_zh: 尚无 COVID-19 感染对分娩影响的数据。
bt_pert_zh: There are no data on the effects of COVID-19 infection on childbirth.

en: One infant girl born to a mother with COVID-19 had elevated IgM levels two hours after birth, suggesting that she had been infected in utero and supporting the possibility of vertical transmission in some cases.
zh: 一名感染 COVID-19 的母亲分娩的女婴在出生后两小时 IgM 水平升高，表明女婴在子宫内已经发生感染，从而支持在某些情况下发生垂直传播的可能性。
pert_zh: 一名感染 COVID-19 的母亲分娩的女婴在出生后两小时 IgM 水平升高，表明女婴在子宫内已经发生感染，从而支持在情况下发生垂直传播的可能性。
bt_pert_zh: A baby girl born to a mother infected with COVID-19 had elevated IgM levels two hours after birth, suggesting that the baby girl had been infected in utero, supporting the possibility of vertical transmission in the setting.

en: A small study involving 6 confirmed COVID-19 mothers showed no indication of SARS-COV-19 in their newborns' throats or serum but antibodies were present in neonatal blood sera samples, including IgM in two of the infants.
zh: 一项包括 6 名已确诊 COVID-19 孕妇的小样本研究显示，新生儿的咽拭子或血清样本中没有 SARS-COV-19 的迹象，但在新生儿血清样本中发现了抗体，包括在两名婴儿中发现的 IgM。
pert_zh: 一项包括 6 名已确诊 COVID-19 孕妇的小样本研究显示，在新生儿血清样本中发现了抗体，包括在两名婴儿中发现的 IgM。
bt_pert_zh: A small study of six pregnant women with confirmed COVID-19 showed antibodies in newborn serum samples, including IgM in two infants.

en: This is not usually passed from mother to fetus so further research is required to know whether the virus crossed the placenta or whether placentas of women in the study were damaged or abnormal.
zh: 通常不会发生母婴传播，因此需要进一步研究以了解病毒是否会穿过胎盘，或者该研究中的孕妇是否存在胎盘损伤或异常。
pert_zh: 通常不会发生母婴传播，因此需要进一步研究以了解病毒是否会穿过胎盘，或者该研究中的孕妇存在胎盘损伤或异常。
bt_pert_zh: Mother-to-child transmission does not usually occur, so further research is needed to understand whether the virus crosses the placenta or if the pregnant women in this study had placental damage or abnormalities.

en: Since COVID-19 shows similarities to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, it is likely that their effect on pregnancy are similar.
zh: 由于 COVID-19 显示了与 SARS-CoV 以及 MERS-CoV 具有相似性，因此它们对妊娠的影响可能相似。
pert_zh: 由于 COVID-19 显示了 SARS-CoV 以及 MERS-CoV 具有相似性，因此它们对妊娠的影响可能相似。
bt_pert_zh: Because COVID-19 has shown similarities to SARS-CoV as well as MERS-CoV, their effects on pregnancy may be similar.

en: Four of seven had first trimester miscarriage, two of five had fetal growth restriction in the second trimester, and four of five had preterm birth.
zh: 4/7 出现妊娠早期流产，2/5 出现妊娠中期胎儿生长受限，4/5 出现早产。
pert_zh: 4/7 出现妊娠早期流产，2/5 妊娠中期胎儿生长受限，4/5 出现早产。
bt_pert_zh: 4/7 experienced early pregnancy miscarriage, 2/5 experienced mid-pregnancy fetal growth restriction, and 4/5 experienced premature birth.

en: None of the newborns were infected with SARS-CoV.
zh: 所有新生儿均未感染 SARS-CoV。
pert_zh: 所有新生儿未感染 SARS-CoV。
bt_pert_zh: All neonates were free of SARS-CoV infection.

en: A report of ten cases of MERS- CoV infection in pregnancy in Saudi Arabia showed that the clinical presentation is variable, from mild to severe infection.
zh: 来自沙特阿拉伯的一项报告显示，10 名在妊娠期间感染 MERS-CoV 的孕妇临床表现各异，包括轻度和重度感染。
pert_zh: 来自沙特阿拉伯的一项报告显示，10 名感染 MERS-CoV 的孕妇临床表现各异，包括轻度和重度感染。
bt_pert_zh: A report from Saudi Arabia showed that 10 pregnant women infected with MERS-CoV had a variety of clinical manifestations, including mild and severe infection.

en: The outcome was favorable in a majority of the cases, but the infant death rate was 27%.A recent review suggested that COVID-19 appeared to be less lethal to mothers and infants than SARS and MERS but that there may be an increased risk of preterm birth after 28 weeks' gestation.
zh: 大多数病例结局良好，但婴儿死亡率为 27%。最近的评论表明，COVID-19 对孕妇和婴儿的致死性似乎低于 SARS 和 MERS，但妊娠 28 周后发生早产的风险可能增加。
pert_zh: 大多数病例结局良好，但婴儿死亡率为 27%。最近的评论表明，COVID-19 对孕妇和婴儿的致死性似乎低于 SARS 和 MERS，但早产的风险可能增加。
bt_pert_zh: Most cases have a good outcome, but the infant mortality rate is 27%. Recent reviews suggest that COVID-19 appears to be less deadly to pregnant women and infants than SARS and MERS, but there may be an increased risk of premature birth.

en: The World Health Organization and  Centers for Disease Control and Prevention of the United States advises pregnant women to do the same things as the general public to avoid infection, such as covering cough, avoid interacting with sick people, cleaning hands with soap and water or sanitizer.
zh: 世界卫生组织和美国疾病预防控制中心建议孕妇采取与普通大众相同的措施来避免感染，例如遮挡咳嗽、避免与患者互动、使用肥皂和水或清洁剂洗手。
pert_zh: 世界卫生组织和美国疾病预防控制中心建议孕妇采取与普通大众相同的措施来避免感染，例如遮挡咳嗽、避免互动、使用肥皂和水或清洁剂洗手。
bt_pert_zh: The World Health Organization and the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommend that pregnant women take the same steps as the general public to avoid infection, such as covering coughs, avoiding interactions, and washing hands with soap and water or detergent.

en: A survey conducted in Shanghai among pregnant women in different trimesters of pregnancy identified a strong demand for online access to health information and services.
zh: 上海对不同孕期的孕妇进行的一项调查发现了对在线获取健康信息和服务的强烈需求。
pert_zh: 上海对不同孕期的孕妇进行的一项调查发现了在线获取健康信息和服务的强烈需求。
bt_pert_zh: A survey of pregnant women at different stages of pregnancy in Shanghai found a strong demand for online access to health information and services.

en: People expecting their first baby were more willing to have online consultation and guidance than who had previously given birth.The RCOG and RCM recommend that in-person appointments be deferred by 7 days after the start of symptoms of COVID-19 or 14 days if another person in the household has symptoms.
zh: 与以前生过孩子的孕妇相比，头胎孕妇更愿意接受在线咨询和指导。RCOG 和 RCM 建议在出现 COVID-19 症状后将现场预约推迟 7 天，如果家庭中有其他人出现症状，则推迟 14 天。
pert_zh: 与以前生过孩子的孕妇相比，头胎孕妇更愿意接受在线咨询和指导。RCOG 和 RCM 在出现 COVID-19 症状后将现场预约推迟 7 天，如果家庭中有其他人出现症状，则推迟 14 天。
bt_pert_zh: Pregnant women with their first child were more willing to accept online consultation and guidance than those who had given birth previously. The RCOG and RCM are deferring in-person appointments for seven days after developing COVID-19 symptoms, or 14 days if someone else in the household has symptoms.

en: Fever subsequently developed in three asymptomatic patients.
zh: 三名无症状患者随后出现发热。
pert_zh: 三名无症状患者出现发热。
bt_pert_zh: Three asymptomatic patients developed fever.

en: One patient who had tested negative subsequently became symptomatic postpartum and tested positive three days after the initial negative test.
zh: 一名检测结果为阴性的患者在产后出现症状，并且在初次检测阴性后三天的检测结果为阳性。

bt_pert_zh: One patient who tested negative developed symptoms postpartum and tested positive three days after the initial test.

en: The doctors conducting the screening recommended that in order to reduce infection and allocate PPE, due to high numbers of patients presenting as asymptomatic, universal screening of pregnant patients should be conducted.
zh: 进行筛查的医生建议，由于大量患者表现为无症状，为了减少感染和分配 PPE，应该对孕妇进行普查。
pert_zh: 进行筛查的医生建议，由于大量患者表现为无症状，应该对孕妇进行普查。
bt_pert_zh: Doctors who conduct the screening recommend that pregnant women should be screened universally because a large number of patients are asymptomatic.

en: They also suggest that people with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 should have continuous electronic fetal monitoring.
zh: 他们还建议疑似或确诊 COVID-19 的孕妇应进行持续的电子胎儿监护。
pert_zh: 他们还建议或确诊 COVID-19 的孕妇应进行持续的电子胎儿监护。
bt_pert_zh: They also recommend or pregnant women diagnosed with COVID-19 should undergo continuous electronic fetal monitoring.

en: The use of birthing pools is not recommended for suspected or confirmed cases of COVID-19 due to the risk of infection via faeces.
zh: 由于存在通过粪便感染的风险，不建议 COVID-19 的疑似或确诊病例使用分娩池。
pert_zh: 由于存在通过粪便感染的风险，不建议 COVID-19 的确诊病例使用分娩池。
bt_pert_zh: Due to the risk of infection through feces, birthing pools are not recommended for confirmed cases of COVID-19.

en: In the UK, official recommendations state that precautionary separation of a mother and a healthy baby should not be undertaken lightly and that they should be kept together in the postpartum period where neonatal care is not required.Literature from China recommended separation of infected mothers from babies for 14 days.
zh: 英国官方建议指出，不应轻率地对母亲和健康的婴儿进行预防性隔离，在不需要新生儿护理的情况下，她们应该在产后期待在一起。来自中国的文献建议将受到感染的母亲与婴儿隔离 14 天。
pert_zh: 英国官方建议指出，不应轻率地对母亲和健康的婴儿进行预防性隔离，在不需要新生儿护理的情况下，她们应该在一起。来自中国的文献建议将受到感染的母亲与婴儿隔离 14 天。
bt_pert_zh: Official UK advice states that preventive isolation of mothers and healthy babies should not be taken lightly and that they should be kept together unless neonatal care is required. Literature from China recommends isolating infected mothers from their babies for 14 days.

en: In the US there is also the recommendation that newborns and mothers should be temporarily separated until transmission-based precautions are discontinued, and that where this is not possible the newborn should be kept 2 metres away from the mother.
zh: 美国也建议，在停止预防传播的措施之前，新生儿和母亲应暂时隔离；如果无法做到，新生儿应与母亲保持 2 米的距
pert_zh: 美国也建议，在停止预防传播的措施之前，新生儿和母亲应暂时隔离；如果无法做到，母亲应与新生儿保持 2 米的距。
bt_pert_zh: The United States also recommends that newborns and mothers should be temporarily isolated until measures to prevent transmission are stopped; if this is not possible, mothers should keep a distance of 2 meters from their newborns.

en: b'COVID-19 surveillance involves monitoring the spread of the coronavirus disease in order to establish the patterns of disease progression.
zh: COVID-19 监测包括监测冠状病毒病的传播，以便确定疾病进展的模式。
pert_zh: COVID-19 监测监测冠状病毒病的传播，以便确定疾病进展的模式。
bt_pert_zh: COVID-19 surveillance monitors the spread of coronavirus disease in order to identify patterns in disease progression.

en: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends active surveillance, with focus of case finding, testing and contact tracing in all transmission scenarios.
zh: 世界卫生组织 (World Health Organization, WHO) 建议进行主动监测，重点是在所有传播场景下进行病例搜索、检测以及接触者追踪。
pert_zh: 世界卫生组织 (World Health Organization, WHO) 建议进行主动监测，重点是在所有传播场景下进行检测以及接触者追踪。
bt_pert_zh: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends active surveillance, focusing on testing in all transmission scenarios and contact tracing.

en: COVID-19 surveillance is expected to monitor epidemiological trends, rapidly detect new cases, and based on this information, provide epidemiological information to conduct risk assessment and guide disease preparedness.
zh: 预计 COVID-19 监测将监控流行病学趋势，迅速发现新病例，并基于此信息提供流行病学信息，以进行风险评估和指导疾病预防。
pert_zh: 预计 COVID-19 监测将监控流行病学趋势，迅速发现新病例，并提供流行病学信息，以进行风险评估和指导疾病预防。
bt_pert_zh: COVID-19 surveillance is expected to monitor epidemiological trends, rapidly detect new cases, and provide epidemiological information for risk assessment and to guide disease prevention.

en: Syndromic surveillance is done based on the symptoms of an individual that corresponds to COVID-19.
zh: 根据符合 COVID-19 的个体症状进行症状监测。
pert_zh: 根据 COVID-19 的个体症状进行症状监测。
bt_pert_zh: Conduct symptom monitoring based on individual symptoms of COVID-19.

en: As of March 2020, the WHO recommends the following case definitions:
zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月，WHO 建议使用以下病例定义：
pert_zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月，WHO 建议以下病例定义：
bt_pert_zh: As of March 2020, WHO recommends the following case definition:

en: Probable case : "A suspect case for whom testing for the COVID-19 virus is inconclusive" OR "a suspect case for whom testing could not be performed for any reason".
zh: 疑似病例：“COVID-19 病毒检测结果不明确的可疑病例”或“由于任何原因无法进行检测的可疑病例”。
pert_zh: 疑似病例：“COVID-19 病毒检测结果不明确的可疑病例”或“由于任何原因无法进行检测的”。
bt_pert_zh: Suspected case: “Suspected case with indeterminate COVID-19 virus test result” or “unable to be tested for any reason”.

en: Confirmed case: "A person with laboratory confirmation of COVID-19 infection, irrespective of clinical signs and symptoms".
zh: 确诊病例：“经实验室检测确认为 COVID-19 感染者，不论是否有临床体征和症状”。
pert_zh: 确诊病例：“经实验室检测确认为 COVID-19 感染者，不论是否有临床症状”。
bt_pert_zh: Confirmed case: “A person confirmed by laboratory testing to be infected with COVID-19, regardless of whether they have clinical symptoms.”

en: Direct physical contact with a probable or confirmed case;
zh: 与疑似或确诊病例有过直接身体接触；
pert_zh: 与或确诊病例有过直接身体接触；
bt_pert_zh: had direct physical contact with a confirmed case;

en: Direct care for a patient with probable or confirmed COVID-19 disease without using proper personal protective equipment;
zh: 在未使用合适个人防护装备的情况下，直接护理疑似或确诊的 COVID-19 疾病病例；
pert_zh: 在未使用合适个人防护装备的情况下，直接护理确诊的 COVID-19 疾病病例；
bt_pert_zh: providing direct care for a confirmed case of COVID-19 illness without using appropriate personal protective equipment;

en: Other situations as indicated by local risk assessments".WHO recommends reporting of probable and confirmed cases of COVID-19 infection within 48 hours of identification.
zh: 当地风险评估提示的其他情形”。WHO 建议在发现后 48 小时内报告疑似和确诊的 COVID-19 感染病例。
pert_zh: 当地风险评估提示的其他情形”。WHO 建议在发现后 48 小时内报告 COVID-19 感染病例。
bt_pert_zh: Other situations indicated by local risk assessment". WHO recommends reporting cases of COVID-19 infection within 48 hours of detection.

en: The countries should report on a case-by-case basis as far as possible, but in case of limitation in resources, aggregate weekly reporting is also possible.
zh: 各国应尽可能逐例报告，但在资源有限的情况下，也可以每周汇总报告。
pert_zh: 各国应尽可能逐例报告，在资源有限的情况下，也可以每周汇总报告。
bt_pert_zh: States should report on a case-by-case basis whenever possible or, where resources are limited, on a weekly basis.

en: Some organizations have created crowdsourced apps for syndromic surveillance, where people can report their symptoms to help researchers map areas with concentration of COVID-19 symptoms.
zh: 一些组织已经创建了用于症状监测的众包手机应用程序，人们可以使用它报告症状，以帮助研究人员绘制 COVID-19 症状集中区域的地图。
pert_zh: 一些组织已经创建了用于症状监测的众包手机应用程序，人们可以使用它报告症状。
bt_pert_zh: Some organizations have created crowdsourced mobile phone apps for symptom monitoring, which people can use to report symptoms.

en: Virological surveillance is done by using molecular tests for COVID-19.
zh: 通过 COVID-19 分子检测完成病毒学监测。
pert_zh: 通过 COVID-19 分子检测完成监测。
bt_pert_zh: Monitoring is done through COVID-19 molecular testing.

en: WHO has published resources for laboratories on how to perform testing for COVID-19.
zh: WHO 已经为实验室发布了有关如何进行 COVID-19 检测的资源。
pert_zh: WHO 已经发布了有关如何进行 COVID-19 检测的资源。
bt_pert_zh: The WHO has published resources on how to get tested for COVID-19.

en: In the European Union, laboratory confirmed cases of COVID-19 are reported within 24 hours of identification.
zh: 欧盟要求在发现后 24 小时内报告经实验室检测确诊的 COVID-19 病例。
pert_zh: 欧盟要求在发现后 24 小时内经实验室检测确诊的 COVID-19 病例。
bt_pert_zh: The EU requires COVID-19 cases to be confirmed by laboratory testing within 24 hours of detection.

en: At least 24 countries have established digital surveillance of their citizens.
zh: 至少有 24 个国家对其公民开展了数字化监测。
pert_zh: 至少有 24 个国家开展了数字化监测。
bt_pert_zh: At least 24 countries have implemented digital surveillance.

en: The digital surveillance technologies include apps, location data and electronic tags.
zh: 数字化监测技术包括手机应用程序、位置数据和电子标签。
pert_zh: 数字化监测技术包括手机应用程序和电子标签。
bt_pert_zh: Digital monitoring technologies include mobile phone apps and electronic tags.

en: The Center For Disease Control and Prevention in USA tracks the travel information of individuals using airline passenger data.
zh: 美国疾病预防控制中心使用航空旅客数据跟踪个人旅行信息。
pert_zh: 美国疾病预防控制中心航空旅客数据跟踪个人旅行信息。
bt_pert_zh: CDC Air Passenger Data tracks individual travel information.

en: In Hong Kong, authorities are requiring a bracelet and an app for all travellers.
zh: 香港的有关部门要求所有游客都佩戴手环并安装相应手机应用程序。
pert_zh: 香港的有关部门要求游客都佩戴手环并安装手机应用程序。
bt_pert_zh: Relevant departments in Hong Kong require tourists to wear wristbands and install mobile phone applications.

en: A GPS app is used to track the locations of individuals in South Korea to ensure against quarantine breach, sending alerts to the user and to authorities if people leave designated areas.
zh: 韩国使用 GPS 应用程序跟踪个人位置以确保不违反隔离规定，如果有人离开指定区域，程序会向该用户和有关部门发送警报。
pert_zh: 韩国使用 GPS 应用程序跟踪个人位置以确保不违反隔离规定，程序会向有关部门发送警报。
bt_pert_zh: South Korea uses GPS apps to track individual locations to ensure quarantine rules are not violated, and the apps send alerts to relevant authorities.

en: In Singapore, individuals have to report their locations with photographic proof.
zh: 新加坡的人员必须使用照片证据报告其位置。
pert_zh: 新加坡人员必须使用照片证据报告其位置。
bt_pert_zh: Singapore personnel are required to report their location using photographic evidence.

en: Thailand is using an app and SIM cards for all travelers to enforce their quarantine.
zh: 泰国利用手机应用程序和 SIM 卡对所有游客实施隔离。
pert_zh: 泰国利用手机应用程序和 SIM 卡隔离。
bt_pert_zh: Thailand uses mobile phone apps and SIM cards for quarantine.

en: Human rights organizations have criticized some of these measures, asking the governments not to use the pandemic as a cover to introduce invasive digital surveillance.
zh: 人权组织已经批评了其中一些措施，反对政府以疫情为借口引入侵入性数字化监测手段。
pert_zh: 人权组织已经批评了其中一些措施，反对政府引入侵入性数字化监测手段。
bt_pert_zh: Human rights groups have criticised some of the measures, objecting to the government's introduction of invasive digital surveillance techniques.

en: b'Coronaviruses are a group of related viruses that cause diseases in mammals and birds.
zh: 冠状病毒是引起哺乳动物和鸟类疾病的一组相关病毒。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒是引起哺乳动物疾病的一组相关病毒。
bt_pert_zh: Coronaviruses are a group of related viruses that cause disease in mammals.

en: In humans, coronaviruses cause respiratory tract infections that can range from mild to lethal.
zh: 在人类中，这些病毒会引起呼吸道感染，程度从轻微到致命不等。
pert_zh: 在人类中，这些病毒会引起程度从轻微到致命不等。
bt_pert_zh: In humans, these viruses can cause illness ranging from mild to fatal.

en: Mild illnesses include some cases of the common cold (which has other possible causes, predominantly rhinoviruses), while more lethal varieties can cause SARS, MERS, and COVID-19.
zh: 轻微疾病包括一些普通的感冒（也可能由某些其他病毒引起，主要是鼻病毒），更具致死性的病毒变种可导致 SARS、MERS 和 COVID-19。
pert_zh: 轻微疾病包括一些普通的感冒，更具致死性的病毒变种可导致 SARS、MERS 和 COVID-19。
bt_pert_zh: Mild illnesses range from some common colds to more deadly variants of the virus that cause SARS, MERS and COVID-19.

en: Symptoms in other species vary: in chickens, they cause an upper respiratory tract disease, while in cows and pigs they cause diarrhea.
zh: 其他物种的症状各不相同：在鸡中，会引起上呼吸道疾病，而在牛和猪中，则会导致腹泻。
pert_zh: 其他物种的症状各不相同：在鸡中，会引起上呼吸道疾病，而在猪中，则会导致腹泻。
bt_pert_zh: Symptoms in other species vary: in chickens, it causes upper respiratory tract illness, while in pigs, it causes diarrhea.

en: There are yet to be vaccines or antiviral drugs to prevent or treat human coronavirus infections.
zh: 目前尚无预防或治疗人冠状病毒感染的疫苗或抗病毒药物。
pert_zh: 目前尚无预防或治疗冠状病毒感染的疫苗或抗病毒药物。
bt_pert_zh: There are currently no vaccines or antiviral drugs to prevent or treat coronavirus infection.

en: Coronaviruses constitute the subfamily Orthocoronavirinae, in the family Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
zh: 冠状病毒属于核糖病毒域、套式病毒目、冠状病毒科的正冠状病毒亚科。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒属于核糖病毒域、套式病毒目的正冠状病毒亚科。
bt_pert_zh: Coronaviruses belong to the subfamily Orthocoronavirus of the order Nidovirales and the domain Riboviridae.

en: They are enveloped viruses with a positive-sense single-stranded RNA genome and a nucleocapsid of helical symmetry.
zh: 它们是具有阳性单链 RNA 基因组和螺旋对称核衣壳的包膜病毒。
pert_zh: 它们是具有单链 RNA 基因组和螺旋对称核衣壳的包膜病毒。
bt_pert_zh: They are enveloped viruses with a single-stranded RNA genome and a helically symmetric nucleocapsid.

en: The genome size of coronaviruses ranges from approximately 26 to 32 kilobases, one of the largest among RNA viruses.
zh: 冠状病毒的基因组大小约在 2.6 到 3.2 万个碱基之间，是 RNA 病毒中最大的。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒的基因组大小约在 3.2 万个碱基之间，是 RNA 病毒中最大的。
bt_pert_zh: The coronavirus genome size is approximately between 32,000 bases, the largest among RNA viruses.

en: They have characteristic club-shaped spikes that project from their surface, which in electron micrographs create an image reminiscent of the solar corona from which their name derives.
zh: 它们的表面有独特的棒状突起，在电子显微照片中，这种突起形成的图像使人联想到日冕，并由此得名。
pert_zh: 它们的表面有独特的棒状突起，在电子显微照片中，这种突起形成的图像使人联想到，并由此得名。
bt_pert_zh: They have distinctive rod-like protrusions on their surface that form an image reminiscent of humans in electron micrographs, hence the name.

en: Coronaviruses were first discovered in the 1930s when an acute respiratory infection of domesticated chickens was shown to be caused by infectious bronchitis virus (IBV).
zh: 冠状病毒于 20 世纪 30 年代首次被发现，当时证明家禽的急性呼吸道感染是由传染性支气管炎病毒 (IBV) 引起的。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒于 20 世纪 30 年代首次被发现，当时证明家禽的急性呼吸道感染是由病毒引起的。
bt_pert_zh: Coronaviruses were first discovered in the 1930s when acute respiratory infections in poultry were shown to be caused by viruses.

en: In the 1940s, two more animal coronaviruses, mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) and transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV), were isolated.Human coronaviruses were discovered in the 1960s.
zh: 20 世纪 40 年代，另外两种动物冠状病毒，鼠肝炎病毒 (MHV) 和猪传染性胃肠炎病毒 (TGEV) 被分离出来。人冠状病毒在 20 世纪 60 年代被发现。
pert_zh: 20 世纪 40 年代，另外两种动物冠状病毒，鼠肝炎病毒 (MHV) 和猪传染性胃肠炎病毒 (TGEV) 被分离出来。
bt_pert_zh: In the 1940s, two other animal coronaviruses, murine hepatitis virus (MHV) and transmissible gastroenteritis virus of porcine (TGEV), were isolated.

en: The earliest ones studied were from human patients with the common cold, which were later named human coronavirus 229E and human coronavirus OC43.
zh: 最早的研究对象是来自普通感冒患者的病毒，这些病毒后来被命名为人冠状病毒 229E 和人冠状病毒 OC43。
pert_zh: 最早的研究对象是普通感冒患者的病毒，这些病毒后来被命名为人冠状病毒 229E 和人冠状病毒 OC43。
bt_pert_zh: The earliest research subjects were viruses from people with the common cold, which were later named human coronavirus 229E and human coronavirus OC43.

en: They were first imaged by Scottish virologist June Almeida at St. Thomas Hospital in London.
zh: 伦敦圣托马斯医院的苏格兰病毒学家 June Almeida 首次对其进行成像。
pert_zh: 伦敦圣托马斯医院的苏格兰病毒学家首次对其进行成像。
bt_pert_zh: It was imaged for the first time by Scottish virologists at St Thomas' Hospital in London.

en: Other human coronaviruses have since been identified, including SARS-CoV in 2003, HCoV NL63 in 2004, HKU1 in 2005, MERS-CoV in 2012, and SARS-CoV-2 in 2019.
zh: 此后，其他人冠状病毒也相继被确认，包括 2003 年的 SARS-CoV、2004 年的 HCoV NL63、2005 年的 HKU1、2012 年的 MERS-CoV 和 2019 年的 SARS-CoV-2。
pert_zh: 此后，其他冠状病毒也相继被确认，包括 2003 年的 SARS-CoV、2004 年的 HCoV NL63、2005 年的 HKU1、2012 年的 MERS-CoV 和 2019 年的 SARS-CoV-2。
bt_pert_zh: Since then, other coronaviruses have been identified, including SARS-CoV in 2003, HCoV NL63 in 2004, HKU1 in 2005, MERS-CoV in 2012, and SARS-CoV-2 in 2019.

en: Most of these have involved serious respiratory tract infections.
zh: 其中大多数涉及严重的呼吸道感染。
pert_zh: 其中涉及严重的呼吸道感染。
bt_pert_zh: Among them were severe respiratory infections.

en: The name was first used in 1968 by an informal group of virologists in the journal Nature to designate the new family of viruses.
zh: 1968 年，一个非正式的病毒学家小组在《自然》杂志上首次使用该名称来命名新的病毒家族。
pert_zh: 1968 年，一个非正式的病毒学家小组在《自然》杂志上首次使用该名称来命名病毒家族。
bt_pert_zh: The name was first used for the virus family in 1968 by an informal group of virologists in the journal Nature.

en: The name refers to the characteristic appearance of virions (the infective form of the virus) by electron microscopy, which have a fringe of large, bulbous surface projections creating an image reminiscent of a crown or of a solar corona.
zh: 该名称指的是通过电子显微镜观察到的病毒粒子（病毒的传染形式）的特征外观，病毒粒子的边缘带有较大的球状表面突起，其产生的图像让人联想起皇冠或日冕。
pert_zh: 该名称指的是通过电子显微镜观察到的病毒粒子的特征外观。
bt_pert_zh: The name refers to the characteristic appearance of the virus particles as observed through an electron microscope.

en: This morphology is created by the viral spike peplomers, which are proteins on the surface of the virus.
zh: 这种形态是由病毒刺突形成的，它们是病毒表面的蛋白质。
pert_zh: 这种形态是由病毒刺突形成的。
bt_pert_zh: This shape is formed by the virus spikes.

en: Coronaviruses are large pleomorphic spherical particles with bulbous surface projections.
zh: 冠状病毒是具有球状表面突起的大型多形性球形颗粒。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒是具有表面突起的大型多形性球形颗粒。
bt_pert_zh: Coronaviruses are large, pleomorphic, spherical particles with surface projections.

en: The envelope of the virus in electron micrographs appears as a distinct pair of electron dense shells.The viral envelope consists of a lipid bilayer where the membrane (M), envelope (E) and spike (S) structural proteins are anchored.
zh: 电子显微照片中病毒的包膜显示为一对独特的电子致密壳。病毒包膜由脂质双层组成，膜 (M)、包膜 (E) 和棘突 (S) 结构蛋白锚定在其中。
pert_zh: 电子显微照片中病毒的包膜显示为一对独特的电子致密壳。病毒包膜由脂质双层组成，膜 (M) 和棘突 (S) 结构蛋白锚定在其中。
bt_pert_zh: The viral envelope is shown in electron micrographs as a pair of distinctive electron-dense shells. The viral envelope consists of a lipid bilayer in which the membrane (M) and spike (S) structural proteins are anchored.

en: The lipid bilayer envelope, membrane proteins, and nucleocapsid protect the virus when it is outside the host cell.
zh: 当病毒位于宿主细胞之外时，脂质双层膜、膜蛋白和核衣壳可以保护病毒。
pert_zh: 当病毒位于宿主细胞之外时，脂质双层膜、膜蛋白可以保护病毒。
bt_pert_zh: When the virus is outside the host cell, the lipid bilayer membrane and membrane proteins can protect the virus.

en: Coronaviruses contain a positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome.
zh: 冠状病毒包含正义的单链 RNA 基因组。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒正义的单链 RNA 基因组。
bt_pert_zh: The positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome of a coronavirus.

en: The genome size for coronaviruses ranges from 26.4 to 31.7 kilobases.
zh: 冠状病毒的基因组大小约为 2.64 至 3.17 万个碱基。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒的基因组大小约为 3.17 万个碱基。
bt_pert_zh: The coronavirus genome size is approximately 31,700 bases.

en: The genome size is one of the largest among RNA viruses.
zh: 其基因组大小是 RNA 病毒中最大的。
pert_zh: 其基因组大小是 RNA 中最大的。
bt_pert_zh: Its genome size is the largest among RNA.

en: The open reading frames 1a and 1b, which occupy the first two-thirds of the genome, encode the replicase/transcriptase polyprotein.
zh: 占据基因组前三分之二的开放阅读框 1a 和 1b 编码复制酶/转录酶多蛋白。
pert_zh: 占据基因组前三分之二的开放阅读框 1a 编码复制酶/转录酶多蛋白。
bt_pert_zh: Open reading frame 1a, which occupies the first two thirds of the genome, encodes the replicase/transcriptase polyprotein.

en: The replicase/transcriptase polyprotein self cleaves to form nonstructural proteins.The later reading frames encode the four major structural proteins: spike, envelope, membrane, and nucleocapsid.
zh: 复制酶/转录酶多蛋白自身裂解形成非结构蛋白。后面的阅读框编码四种主要的结构蛋白：棘突、包膜、膜和核衣壳。
pert_zh: 复制酶/转录酶多蛋白自身裂解形成非结构蛋白。后面编码四种主要的结构蛋白：棘突、包膜、膜和核衣壳。
bt_pert_zh: The replicase/transcriptase polyprotein cleaves itself to form nonstructural proteins, which then encode four major structural proteins: spike, envelope, membrane, and nucleocapsid.

en: Interspersed between these reading frames are the reading frames for the accessory proteins.
zh: 在这些阅读框之间散布着辅助蛋白的阅读框。
pert_zh: 在这些阅读框之间散布着蛋白的阅读框。
bt_pert_zh: Interspersed between these reading frames are the reading frames for the proteins.

en: The number of accessory proteins and their function is unique depending on the specific coronavirus.
zh: 辅助蛋白的数量及其功能取决于特定的冠状病毒。
pert_zh: 辅助蛋白的数量及其取决于特定的冠状病毒。
bt_pert_zh: The number of accessory proteins and their identity depends on the specific coronavirus.

en: Infection begins when the viral spike (S) glycoprotein attaches to its complementary host cell receptor.
zh: 病毒棘突 (S) 糖蛋白附着在其互补宿主细胞受体后开始感染。
pert_zh: 病毒棘突 (S) 附着在其互补宿主细胞受体后开始感染。
bt_pert_zh: Infection begins after the viral spike (S) attaches to its complementary host cell receptor.

en: After attachment, a protease of the host cell cleaves and activates the receptor-attached spike protein.
zh: 附着后，宿主细胞的蛋白酶裂解并激活受体附着的棘突蛋白。
pert_zh: 附着后，宿主细胞的蛋白酶裂解并受体附着的棘突蛋白。
bt_pert_zh: After attachment, host cell proteases cleave and receptor-bind the attached spike protein.

en: Depending on the host cell protease available, cleavage and activation allows the virus to enter the host cell by endocytosis or direct fusion of the viral envelop with the host membrane.On entry into the host cell, the virus particle is uncoated, and its genome enters the cell cytoplasm.
zh: 根据可用的宿主细胞蛋白酶，裂解和激活允许病毒通过内吞作用或病毒包膜与宿主膜的直接融合进入宿主细胞。进入宿主细胞后，病毒颗粒没有被包裹，其基因组进入细胞质。
pert_zh: 根据可用的宿主细胞蛋白酶，裂解和激活允许病毒通过内吞作用或病毒包膜与宿主膜的直接融合进入宿主细胞。进入宿主细胞后，病毒颗粒没有被包裹。
bt_pert_zh: Depending on the available host cell proteases, cleavage and activation allow the virus to enter the host cell by endocytosis or direct fusion of the viral envelope with the host membrane. After entry into the host cell, the viral particles are not encapsidated.

en: The host ribosome translates the initial overlapping open reading frame of the virus genome and forms a long polyprotein.
zh: 宿主核糖体翻译病毒基因组最初重叠的开放阅读框并形成长的多聚蛋白。
pert_zh: 宿主核糖体翻译病毒基因组最初重叠的开放阅读框形成长的多聚蛋白。
bt_pert_zh: Host ribosomes translate the initial overlapping open reading frames of the viral genome to form long polyproteins.

en: The polyprotein has its own proteases which cleave the polyprotein into multiple nonstructural proteins.
zh: 这种多聚蛋白有自己的蛋白酶，它可以将多聚蛋白裂解成多个非结构蛋白。
pert_zh: 这种多聚蛋白有蛋白酶，它可以将多聚蛋白裂解成多个非结构蛋白。
bt_pert_zh: This polyprotein has a protease that can cleave the polyprotein into multiple non-structural proteins.

en: A number of the nonstructural proteins coalesce to form a multi-protein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).
zh: 许多非结构蛋白结合形成多蛋白复制酶-转录酶复合体 (RTC)。
pert_zh: 许多非结构蛋白结合形成蛋白复制酶-转录酶复合体 (RTC)。
bt_pert_zh: Many nonstructural proteins combine to form the protein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).

en: The main replicase-transcriptase protein is the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp).
zh: 主要的复制酶-转录酶蛋白是 RNA 依赖性 RNA 聚合酶 (RdRp)。
pert_zh: 主要的复制酶-转录酶蛋白是 RNA 依赖性 RNA 聚合酶。
bt_pert_zh: The major replicase-transcriptase protein is an RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.

en: It is directly involved in the replication and transcription of RNA from an RNA strand.
zh: 它直接参与 RNA 链中 RNA 的复制和转录。
pert_zh: 它直接 RNA 链中 RNA 的复制和转录。
bt_pert_zh: It directs the replication and transcription of RNA in RNA chains.

en: The other nonstructural proteins in the complex assist in the replication and transcription process.
zh: 复合体中的其他非结构蛋白协助完成复制和转录过程。
pert_zh: 复合体其他非结构蛋白协助完成复制和转录过程。
bt_pert_zh: Other nonstructural proteins in the complex assist in the replication and transcription processes.

en: The exoribonuclease nonstructural protein, for instance, provides extra fidelity to replication by providing a proofreading function which the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase lacks.One of the main functions of the complex is to replicate the viral genome.
zh: 例如，核糖核酸外切酶非结构蛋白通过提供 RNA 依赖性 RNA 聚合酶所缺乏的校对功能，为复制提供了额外的保真度。该复合体的主要功能之一是复制病毒基因组。
pert_zh: 例如，核糖核酸外切酶非结构蛋白通过提供 RNA 依赖性 RNA 聚合酶所缺乏的校对功能，为复制提供了额外的保真度。复制病毒基因组。
bt_pert_zh: For example, exoribonuclease nonstructural proteins provide additional fidelity to replication by providing a proofreading function that RNA-dependent RNA polymerase lacks in replicating the viral genome.

en: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense genomic RNA from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
zh: RdRp 直接介导正义基因组 RNA 合成反义基因组 RNA。
pert_zh: RdRp 直接介导正义基因组 RNA 合成基因组 RNA。
bt_pert_zh: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of genomic RNA from positive-sense genomic RNA.

en: This is followed by the replication of positive-sense genomic RNA from the negative-sense genomic RNA.
zh: 接下来是从反义基因组 RNA 复制正义基因组 RNA。
pert_zh: 接下来是反义基因组 RNA 复制正义基因组 RNA。
bt_pert_zh: Next the antisense genomic RNA replicates the sense genomic RNA.

en: The other important function of the complex is to transcribe the viral genome.
zh: 该复合体的另一个重要功能是转录病毒基因组。
pert_zh: 该复合体的另一个功能是转录病毒基因组。
bt_pert_zh: Another function of this complex is to transcribe the viral genome.

en: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
zh: RdRp 直接介导正义基因组 RNA 合成反义亚基因组 RNA 分子。
pert_zh: RdRp 直接介导正义基因组 RNA 合成亚基因组 RNA 分子。
bt_pert_zh: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of subgenomic RNA molecules from positive-sense genomic RNA.

en: This is followed by the transcription of these negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules to their corresponding positive-sense mRNAs.
zh: 随后，这些反义亚基因组 RNA 分子转录为其相应的正义 mRNA。
pert_zh: 随后，反义亚基因组 RNA 转录为正义 mRNA。
bt_pert_zh: Subsequently, the antisense subgenomic RNA is transcribed into sense mRNA.

en: The replicated positive-sense genomic RNA becomes the genome of the progeny viruses.
zh: 复制的正义基因组 RNA 成为子代病毒的基因组。
pert_zh: 复制的正义基因组 RNA 成为子代的基因组。
bt_pert_zh: The replicated positive-sense genomic RNA becomes the genome of the progeny.

en: The mRNAs are gene transcripts of the last third of the virus genome after the initial overlapping reading frame.
zh: mRNA 是最初重叠阅读框后病毒基因组最后三分之一的基因转录本。
pert_zh: mRNA 是最初重叠阅读框后病毒基因组基因转录本。
bt_pert_zh: mRNA is a transcript of a gene in the viral genome that initially overlaps the reading frame.

en: These mRNAs are translated by the host's ribosomes into the structural proteins and a number of accessory proteins.
zh: 这些 mRNA 被宿主的核糖体翻译成结构蛋白和若干辅助蛋白。
pert_zh: 这些 mRNA 宿主的核糖体翻译成结构蛋白和若干辅助蛋白。
bt_pert_zh: These mRNAs are translated by host ribosomes into structural proteins and several accessory proteins.

en: RNA translation occurs inside the endoplasmic reticulum.
zh: RNA 翻译发生在内质网内。
pert_zh: RNA 翻译在内质网内。
bt_pert_zh: RNA translation occurs within the endoplasmic reticulum.

en: The viral structural proteins S, E, and M move along the secretory pathway into the Golgi intermediate compartment.
zh: 病毒结构蛋白 S、E 和 M 沿着分泌途径进入高尔基体中间室。
pert_zh: 病毒结构蛋白 S 和 M 沿着分泌途径进入高尔基体中间室。
bt_pert_zh: The viral structural proteins S and M travel along the secretory pathway to the intermediate compartment of the Golgi apparatus.

en: There, the M proteins direct most protein-protein interactions required for assembly of viruses following its binding to the nucleocapsid.
zh: 在那里，M 蛋白在与核衣壳结合后，指导病毒组装所需的绝大多数蛋白-蛋白相互作用。
pert_zh: 在那里，M 蛋白在与核衣壳结合后，指导病毒组装所需的绝大多数蛋白相互作用。
bt_pert_zh: There, the M protein, upon binding to the nucleocapsid, directs the vast majority of protein interactions required for viral assembly.

en: Progeny viruses are then released from the host cell by exocytosis through secretory vesicles.
zh: 之后，子代病毒通过分泌小泡的胞吐作用从宿主细胞中释放出来。
pert_zh: 之后，子代病毒通过分泌小泡的胞吐作用释放出来。
bt_pert_zh: Afterwards, progeny viruses are released by exocytosis of secretory vesicles.

en: The interaction of the coronavirus spike protein with its complement host cell receptor is central in determining the tissue tropism, infectivity, and species range of the virus.
zh: 冠状病毒棘突蛋白与其补体宿主细胞受体的相互作用在确定病毒的组织嗜性、感染性和物种范围方面至关重要。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒棘突蛋白与其补体宿主受体的相互作用在确定病毒的组织嗜性、感染性和物种范围方面至关重要。
bt_pert_zh: The interaction of the coronavirus spike protein with its complement host receptor is critical in determining the virus's tissue tropism, infectivity, and species range.

en: The SARS coronavirus, for example, infects human cells by attaching to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.
zh: 例如，SARS 冠状病毒通过附在血管紧张素转换酶2 (ACE2) 受体上而感染人类细胞。
pert_zh: 例如，SARS 冠状病毒通过附在细胞。
bt_pert_zh: For example, the SARS coronavirus attaches itself to cells.

en: The scientific name for coronavirus is Orthocoronavirinae or Coronavirinae.
zh: 冠状病毒的学名是 Orthocoronavirinae 或 Coronavirinae。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒的学名是 Coronavirinae。
bt_pert_zh: The scientific name of coronavirus is Coronavirinae.

en: Coronaviruses belong to the family of Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
zh: 冠状病毒属于核糖病毒域、套式病毒目、冠状病毒科。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒属于核糖病毒域、冠状病毒科。
bt_pert_zh: Coronaviruses belong to the Ribovirus domain, Coronaviridae family.

en: Genus Betacoronavirus; type species: Murine coronavirus
zh: β-冠状病毒；模式种：鼠冠状病毒
pert_zh: β-冠状病毒；种：鼠冠状病毒
bt_pert_zh: Beta-coronavirus; Species: Mouse coronavirus

en: Species: Betacoronavirus 1 (Bovine Coronavirus, Human coronavirus OC43), Human coronavirus HKU1, Murine coronavirus, Pipistrellus bat coronavirus HKU5, Rousettus bat coronavirus HKU9, Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), Tylonycteris bat coronavirus HKU4, Middle East respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus, Hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV)
zh: 异种：β-冠状病毒 1（牛冠状病毒，人冠状病毒 OC43）、人冠状病毒 HKU1、鼠冠状病毒、伏蝙蝠冠状病毒 HKU5、棕果蝠冠状病毒 HKU9、严重急性呼吸道综合征相关冠状病毒 (SARS-CoV、SARS-CoV-2)、扁颅蝠冠状病毒 HKU4、中东呼吸综合征相关冠状病毒、刺猬冠状病毒 1 (EriCoV)
pert_zh: 异种：β-冠状病毒 1（牛冠状病毒、人冠状病毒 OC43）、人冠状病毒 HKU1、棕果蝠冠状病毒 HKU9、严重急性呼吸道综合征相关冠状病毒 (SARS-CoV、SARS-CoV-2)、扁颅蝠冠状病毒 HKU4、中东呼吸综合征相关冠状病毒、刺猬冠状病毒 1 (EriCoV)
bt_pert_zh: Xenospecies: Betacoronavirus 1 (bovine coronavirus, human coronavirus OC43), human coronavirus HKU1, brown fruit bat coronavirus HKU9, severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), flat-headed bat coronavirus HKU4, Middle East respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus, hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV)

en: Species: Beluga whale coronavirus SW1, Infectious bronchitis virus
zh: 异种：白鲸冠状病毒 SW1、传染性支气管炎病毒
pert_zh: 异种：白鲸冠状病毒 SW1、传染性支气管炎病毒
bt_pert_zh: Xenotype: Beluga coronavirus SW1, infectious bronchitis virus

en: The most recent common ancestor (MRCA) of all coronaviruses is estimated to have existed as recently as 8000 BCE, although some models place the common ancestor as far back as 55 million years or more, implying long term coevolution with bat and avian species.
zh: 据估计，所有冠状病毒的最近共同祖先 (MRCA) 早在公元前 8000 年就已经存在，但也有一些模型将共同祖先追溯到 5500 万年前或更早，这意味着病毒与蝙蝠和鸟类经过了长期共同进化。
pert_zh: 据估计，所有冠状病毒的最近共同祖先 (MRCA) 早在公元前 8000 年就已经存在，但也有一些模型将共同祖先追溯到 5500 万年前或更早，这意味着病毒与蝙蝠和鸟类共同进化。
bt_pert_zh: The most recent common ancestor (MRCA) of all coronaviruses is estimated to have existed as early as 8000 BC, but some models date the common ancestor back to 55 million years ago or earlier, meaning the virus co-evolved with bats and birds.

en: The most recent common ancestor of the alphacoronavirus line has been placed at about 2400 BCE, the betacoronavirus line at 3300 BCE, the gammacoronavirus line at 2800 BCE, and the deltacoronavirus line at about 3000 BCE.
zh: α 冠状病毒系的最近共同祖先位于约公元前 2400年，β 冠状病毒系位于公元前 3300 年，γ 冠状病毒系位于公元前 2800 年，δ 冠状病毒系位于公元前 3000 年左右。
pert_zh: α 冠状病毒系的最近共同祖先位于约公元前 2400年，β 冠状病毒系位于公元前 3300 年，γ 冠状病毒系位于公元前 2800 年。
bt_pert_zh: The most recent common ancestor of the alphacoronavirus lineage was around 2400 BC, the betacoronavirus lineage was around 3300 BC, and the gammacoronavirus lineage was around 2800 BC.

en: The large number of host bat and avian species, and their global range, has enabled extensive evolution and dissemination of coronaviruses.Many human coronavirus have their origin in bats.
zh: 大量的蝙蝠和鸟类寄主物种及其全球范围，使冠状病毒得以广泛进化和传播。许多人冠状病毒起源于蝙蝠。
pert_zh: 大量的蝙蝠和鸟类寄主物种及其全球范围，使冠状病毒得以广泛进化和传播。
bt_pert_zh: The large number of bat and bird host species and their global range allow coronaviruses to evolve and spread widely.

en: More recently, alpaca coronavirus and human coronavirus 229E diverged sometime before 1960.
zh: 最近的一次进化发生在 1960 年前的某个时候，羊驼冠状病毒和人冠状病毒 229E 出现了分化。
pert_zh: 最近的一次进化发生在 1960 年前的某个时候，羊驼冠状病毒和 229E 出现了分化。
bt_pert_zh: The most recent evolution occurred sometime before 1960, when the alpaca coronavirus and 229E diverged.

en: MERS-CoV emerged in humans from bats through the intermediate host of camels.
zh: 起源于蝙蝠的 MERS-CoV 通过中间的骆驼宿主在人类中出现。
pert_zh: 起源于蝙蝠的 MERS-CoV 通过骆驼宿主在人类中出现。
bt_pert_zh: MERS-CoV, which originated in bats, emerged in humans via camel hosts.

en: MERS-CoV, although related to several bat coronavirus species, appears to have diverged from these several centuries ago.
zh: MERS-CoV 虽然与几种蝙蝠冠状病毒有亲缘关系，但似乎在几个世纪前就已经从这些冠状病毒中分化出来了。
pert_zh: MERS-CoV 虽然与蝙蝠冠状病毒有亲缘关系，但似乎在几个世纪前就已经从这些冠状病毒中分化出来了。
bt_pert_zh: Although MERS-CoV is related to bat coronaviruses, it appears to have diverged from these coronaviruses centuries ago.

en: The most closely related bat coronavirus and SARS-CoV diverged in 1986.
zh: 关系最密切的蝙蝠冠状病毒和 SARS-CoV 在 1986 年发生了分化。
pert_zh: 关系最密切的蝙蝠冠状病毒在 1986 年发生了分化。
bt_pert_zh: The most closely related bat coronaviruses diverged in 1986.

en: A possible path of evolution, of SARS coronavirus and keen bat coronaviruses, suggests that SARS related coronaviruses coevolved in bats for a long time.
zh: SARS 冠状病毒和蝙蝠冠状病毒可能的进化路径表明，SARS 相关的冠状病毒在蝙蝠体内共同进化了很长一段时间。
pert_zh: SARS 冠状病毒和蝙蝠冠状病毒的进化路径表明，SARS 相关的冠状病毒在蝙蝠体内共同进化了很长一段时间。
bt_pert_zh: The evolutionary paths of SARS coronavirus and bat coronavirus suggest that SARS-related coronaviruses have co-evolved in bats for a long time.

en: In the 1790s, equine coronavirus diverged from the bovine coronavirus after a cross-species jump.
zh: 18 世纪 90 年代，马冠状病毒在跨物种跳跃后从牛冠状病毒中分离出来。
pert_zh: 18 世纪 90 年代，马冠状病毒在跨物种跳跃后从中分离出来。
bt_pert_zh: The equine coronavirus was isolated from it in the 1790s after jumping across species.

en: Later in the 1890s, human coronavirus OC43 diverged from bovine coronavirus after another cross-species spillover event.
zh: 19 世纪 90 年代后期，人冠状病毒 OC43 在另一次跨物种溢出事件后从牛冠状病毒中分离出来。
pert_zh: 19 世纪 90 年代后期，人冠状病毒 OC43 在另一次跨物种溢出事件中分离出来。
bt_pert_zh: In the late 1890s, human coronavirus OC43 was isolated in another cross-species spillover event.

en: It is speculated that the flu pandemic of 1890 may have been caused by this spillover event, and not by the influenza virus, because of the related timing, neurological symptoms, and unknown causative agent of the pandemic.
zh: 据推测，鉴于大流行的相关时间、神经学症状和未知的病原体，1890 年的流感大流行可能是由这一溢出事件而不是由流感病毒引起的。
pert_zh: 据推测，鉴于大流行的相关时间、神经学症状和未知的病原体，1890 年的流感大流行可能是由这一溢出事件而不是流感病毒引起的。
bt_pert_zh: It has been speculated that the 1890 influenza pandemic may have been caused by this spillover event rather than influenza virus, given the relative timing of the pandemic, the neurological symptoms, and the unknown pathogen.

en: Human coronavirus OC43 besides causing respiratory infections is also suspected of playing a role in neurological diseases.
zh: 人冠状病毒 OC43 除引起呼吸道感染外，还被怀疑与神经系统疾病有关。
pert_zh: 人冠状病毒 OC43 除引起呼吸道感染外，还被怀疑与神经系统疾病有关。

en: In the 1950s, the human coronavirus OC43 began to diverge into its present genotypes.

en: Phylogentically, mouse hepatitis virus (Murine coronavirus), which infects the mouse's liver and the central nervous system, is related to  human coronavirus OC43 and bovine coronavirus.
zh: 从生物系统上来说，感染小鼠肝脏和中枢神经系统的小鼠肝炎病毒（鼠冠状病毒），与人冠状病毒 OC43 和牛冠状病毒有关。

en: Some can kill more than 30% of those infected, such as MERS-CoV, and some are relatively harmless, such as the common cold.
zh: 有些病毒可导致 30% 以上的感染者致死，如 MERS-CoV，有些则相对无害，只引起普通感冒等轻微病症。

bt_pert_zh: Some viruses kill 30% of those they infect, like MERS-CoV, while others are relatively harmless, causing only mild illnesses like the common cold.

en: Coronaviruses can cause colds with major symptoms, such as fever, and a sore throat from swollen adenoids.

en: Coronaviruses can cause pneumonia (either direct viral pneumonia or secondary bacterial pneumonia) and bronchitis (either direct viral bronchitis or secondary bacterial bronchitis).

pert_zh: 冠状病毒可引起肺炎和支气管炎。
bt_pert_zh: Coronavirus can cause pneumonia and bronchitis.

en: The human coronavirus discovered in 2003, SARS-CoV, which causes severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), has a unique pathogenesis because it causes both upper and lower respiratory tract infections.Six species of human coronaviruses are known, with one species subdivided into two different strains, making seven strains of human coronaviruses altogether.
zh: 2003 年发现的人冠状病毒 SARS-CoV 可引起严重急性呼吸道综合征 (SARS)，它有独特的发病机制，因为它可同时引起上下呼吸道感染。目前已知有六种人冠状病毒，其中一种又细分为两种不同的病毒株，因此共形成了七种人冠状病毒。
pert_zh: 2003 年发现的人冠状病毒 SARS-CoV 可引起严重急性呼吸道综合征 (SARS)，它有独特的发病机制，因为它可同时引起上呼吸道感染。目前已知有六种人冠状病毒，其中一种又细分为两种不同的病毒株，因此共形成了七种人冠状病毒。
bt_pert_zh: The human coronavirus SARS-CoV, discovered in 2003, causes severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and has a unique pathogenesis because it can also cause upper respiratory tract infection. There are currently six known human coronaviruses, one of which is subdivided into two different strains, making a total of seven human coronaviruses.

en: Four of these coronaviruses continually circulate in the human population and produce the generally mild symptoms of the common cold in adults and children worldwide: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.
zh: 其中四种冠状病毒在人群中持续传播，并在全世界成人和儿童中产生一般较轻的普通感冒症状：-OC43、-HKU1、HCoV-229E、-NL63。

bt_pert_zh: Four of these coronaviruses continue to circulate among people, causing generally milder common cold symptoms in adults and children worldwide: -OC43, -HKU1, and -NL63.

en: Coronaviruses cause about 15% of commons colds.

en: The four mild coronaviruses have a seasonal incidence occurring in the winter months in temperate climates.

bt_pert_zh: In tropical climates, coronaviruses have no seasonal preferences.

en: The virus was officially named the SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV).

pert_zh: 这种病毒被正式命名为冠状病毒 (SARS-CoV)。
bt_pert_zh: The virus was officially named coronavirus (SARS-CoV).

en: More than 8,000 people were infected, about ten percent of whom died.
zh: 超过 8,000 人已感染，其中约 10% 死亡。
pert_zh: 超过 8,000 人已感染，约 10% 死亡。

en: In September 2012, a new type of coronavirus was identified, initially called Novel Coronavirus 2012, and now officially named Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
zh: 2012 年 9 月，一种新型冠状病毒被发现，最初被称为 2012 新型冠状病毒，现在被正式命名为中东呼吸综合征冠状病毒 (MERS-CoV)。
pert_zh: 2012 年 9 月，一种新型冠状病毒被发现，最初被称为 2012 新型冠状病毒，被正式命名为中东呼吸综合征冠状病毒 (MERS-CoV)。
bt_pert_zh: In September 2012, a new coronavirus was discovered, initially referred to as the 2012 novel coronavirus and officially named Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).

en: The World Health Organization issued a global alert soon after.

bt_pert_zh: The World Health Organization has issued a global alert.

en: The WHO update on 28 September 2012 said the virus did not seem to pass easily from person to person.
zh: WHO 在 2012 年 9 月 28 日的更新中称，该病毒似乎在人与人之间不易传播。

en: However, on 12 May 2013, a case of human-to-human transmission in France was confirmed by the French Ministry of Social Affairs and Health.

pert_zh: 此外，突尼斯卫生部报告了人传人病例。

en: The final name for the virus is Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).

pert_zh: 该病毒最终被中东呼吸综合征冠状病毒 (MERS-CoV)。
bt_pert_zh: The virus was eventually identified as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus (MERS-CoV).

en: The only U.S. cases (both survived) were recorded in May 2014.In May 2015, an outbreak of MERS-CoV occurred in the Republic of Korea, when a man who had traveled to the Middle East, visited four hospitals in the Seoul area to treat his illness.
zh: 2014 年 5 月，美国记录了仅有的两例（均存活）。2015 年 5 月，一名去过中东的男子前往首尔地区的四家医院看诊，由此 MERS-CoV 在韩国爆发。
pert_zh: 2014 年 5 月，美国记录了仅有的两例（均存活）。2015 年 5 月，一名去过中东的男子前往看诊，由此 MERS-CoV 在韩国爆发。
bt_pert_zh: The only two cases (both alive) were recorded in the U.S. in May 2014. In May 2015, an outbreak of MERS-CoV occurred in South Korea following a visit to a doctor in a man who had traveled to the Middle East.

en: This caused one of the largest outbreaks of MERS-CoV outside the Middle East.

en: As of December 2019, 2,468 cases of MERS-CoV infection had been confirmed by laboratory tests, 851 of which were fatal, a mortality rate of approximately 34.5%.
zh: 截至 2019 年 12 月，经实验室检测确诊的 MERS-CoV 感染病例为 2,468 例，其中死亡 851 例，死亡率约为 34.5%。

bt_pert_zh: As of December 2019, there were 2,468 laboratory-confirmed cases of MERS-CoV infection, including 3 deaths, with a mortality rate of approximately 34.5%.

en: In December 2019, a pneumonia outbreak was reported in Wuhan, China.

en: On 31 December 2019, the outbreak was traced to a novel strain of coronavirus, which was given the interim name 2019-nCoV by the World Health Organization (WHO), later renamed SARS-CoV-2 by the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses.
zh: 2019 年 12 月 31 日，疫情爆发被追溯到一种新型冠状病毒，世界卫生组织 (WHO) 将其临时命名为 2019-nCoV，后来国际病毒分类学委员会将其更名为 SARS-CoV-2。

bt_pert_zh: On December 31, 2019, the outbreak was traced to a novel coronavirus, which the World Health Organization (WHO) provisionally named 2019-nCoV and the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses renamed SARS-CoV-2.

en: Some researchers have suggested the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market may not be the original source of viral transmission to humans.As of 17 April 2020, there have been at least 153,822 confirmed deaths and more than 2,240,191 confirmed cases in the coronavirus pneumonia pandemic.
zh: 一些研究人员认为，华南海鲜批发市场可能不是该病毒传染给人类的最初来源。截至 2020 年 4 月 17 日，冠状病毒肺炎疫情已造成至少 153,822 例确诊死亡，超过 2,240,191 例确诊病例。
pert_zh: 一些研究人员认为，华南海鲜批发市场可能不是该病毒传染给人类的来源。
bt_pert_zh: Some researchers believe that the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market may not be the source of the virus' transmission to humans.

en: The Wuhan strain has been identified as a new strain of Betacoronavirus from group 2B with approximately 70% genetic similarity to the SARS-CoV.
